title: Director of Safety and Security
description:
Housing Works requires employees working in our Health Services division to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless approved for a legal accommodation. If you need an accommodation for any reason, including related to this job requirement, please contact Human Resources.

Job candidates should be aware that scammers may pose as employers and create fake job postings in order to extract personal information from individuals for financial gain. Housing Works will never ask job candidates for personal information, such as social security numbers or bank account details, over the phone. If you suspect that a job posting may be fake or wish to confirm that a job posting from Housing Works is genuine, please contact us at recruitment@housingworks.org

Housing Works was founded in 1990; With a long-term commitment to AIDS advocacy. Housing Works established New York State’s first harm reduction-based, OASAS-licensed outpatient drug treatment program. Other services include Health Home care management, behavioral health, and syringe exchange programs. A pioneer in the social entrepreneurship movement, Housing Works operates 10 high-end thrift shops in Manhattan and Brooklyn and a much-loved Bookstore Cafe in Soho. For more information, visit www.housingworks.org

Housing Works fights for funding and legislation to ensure that all people living with HIV/AIDS have access to quality housing, healthcare, HIV prevention, and treatment, among other lifesaving services.

**Benefits:**   
We have three comprehensive healthcare plans to choose from based on your priorities and budget. Housing Works covers most of the plan; you pay a portion, based on your salary. Staff begins accruing PTO immediately for a total of up to 30 days earned in the first year. We offer employees an educational benefit. This money is available for tuition loan reimbursement, tuition costs, and text books.

Housing Works provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements. Housing Works complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Housing Works also does not request prior salary information during the hiring process. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

**Salary Range: $90,000-$95,000 annually**

**The Director for Safety and Security** is responsible for strategic planning, organizing, implementing, managing, and taking initiatives to ensure a safe, and accident-free environment for all employees. Their position requires: performing safety audits, conducting safety training sessions, and creating initiatives to reduce and prevent accidents & incidents on site, identification of opportunities for improvement across all operation and approving all scope of work and proposal to ensure work is following approved safety practices. Secondary Responsibility Manages, supervises, trains, and develops the Safety & Security Specialist and the contracted Security Concierges.

Essential Job Functions:

* Responsible for monitoring the safety and security operations for the organization.
* Maintain and implement safety and security policies and regulations to make sure the environment is safe for employees, clients, and visitors.
* Participate in all investigations involving all safety, security, and risk management related issues.
* Maintain and update security plans, emergency plans, and policies and procedures, in accordance with best practices and ensure their implementation.
* Provide advice and counsel to management on matters relating to employee, client and property safety and security.
* Leads Quarterly Safety & Security Agency Wide Meetings and monthly Site Safety Meetings.
* Analyze data and trends to help support and recommend businesses decisions and best practices for the organization.
* Supervises and develops the Safety & Security Specialist and the outsourced Security Concierges in facilities to support the department’s businesses.
* Conducts monthly safety audits and reports on findings in monthly site safety meetings.
* Oversee and enforce compliance with all OSHA, and other regulatory agencies while maintaining awareness of regulatory changes that could impact the company.
* Promotes a team environment, enlisting active participation of fellow staff members, displays emotional intelligence and understands equity and collaboration.
* Takes ownership, has a strong work ethic with an ability to problem solve and achieve desired outcomes.
* Maintains a high level of professionalism, integrity, and communication with other staff.
* Self-motivated, can self-assess, takes initiative, and demonstrates personal accountability.
* Communicates with clarity, timely and effectively; is flexible and open minded.
* Excellent communication skills, verbal, and written, for explaining security & safety concerns, policies, and training for staff, clients, consultants, volunteers and consistently applying them at all levels.
* Participate in the Organization’s committees.
* Conduct weekly facility visits, weekly meetings with security concierges.

Develop, facilitate and implement safety & security training, which includes:

* Incident Reports, De-Escalation, Active Shooter, Fire Safety, Law Enforcement, Trespassing, OSHA, Key/Key Cards, Cameras
* Co-lead the Quarterly Safety & Security Committee and monthly facility meetings with Safety & Security Specialist.
* Analyze & Report data on incidents monthly, quarterly and annually.
* Oversee the contract with the security vendor for both the clinics and businesses.
* Establish a baseline for when the agency decides when a security concierge is needed and where.
* Monitors security conditions; liaise and coordinate with external agencies.
* Scenario planning, security plan development, crisis/contingency planning
* Analyze CCTV and keycard access needs and manage vendor relations.
* Demonstrate understanding of emergency and security concerns and appropriate responses to them.
* Participate in advocacy and direct action to end the twin crises of homelessness and HIV/AIDS.

Minimum Requirements

* Associate degree or higher.
* License FSD/S95; must obtain within 90 days.
* Accident/Incident Investigation Certificate.
* OSHA certification.
* Security Guard license; must obtain within 90 days.

The following skills/qualifications are viewed as important to success in this position:

* 5 years of related experience.
* Supervisory and/or Management experience required; Ability to be proactive and demonstrate leadership.
* Spend considerable time in the field inspecting job sites to ensure training and policies are being complied with.
* Dependable & flexible, as well as possessing the ability to maintain an elevated level of confidentiality.
* Working knowledge of OSHA, DOB, DOH, and DEP.
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task.
* Solid written and verbal communication skills, including, ability to target messaging recognizing range of personnel, each with different levels of education and knowledge but all equally responsible for ensuring safe work practices.
* Ability to identify challenges and provide solutions.
* Recognizing the critical importance of direct communication with all employees and management team.
* Ability to change with changing times and needs.
* Remaining informed and immersed in industry safety

The following competencies are viewed as important to success in this position:

* Project Management.
* Able to operate standard business office equipment, including computer operation, mobile devices, use of email/internet, as well as Microsoft Office Suite (Office, Excel, Word, TEAMs and SharePoint)
* Be solution and communication oriented while exchanging information, collecting, compiling, and preparing work documents.
* Take the initiative by digging beneath the obvious.
* Can work independently.

This position requires the physical ability to do the following:

* to travel 70% of the time on public transit between facilities
* to lift 100lbs with assistance
* to climb ladders
* Operate a computer and other office machinery.
* Due to the nature of this position, employees may not work remotely, in accordance with the Remote Work Policy contained in the Employee Manual

title: 2024-25 Science Teacher
description:
**Science Teacher**

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of students, including those with special needs, Integration Charter Schools (ICS) in Staten Island, New York, is seeking a dedicated Science Teacher to join our innovative network of charter schools.

**Job Summary:**  
As a Science Teacher at ICS, you will play a crucial role in creating inclusive pathways to academic and social-emotional success for students with special needs. You will work collaboratively with students, families, and colleagues to provide a supportive and enriching learning environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Craft and deliver captivating science lessons aligned to state standards and in support of student success on science exams, such as Regents.
* Tailor teaching methods to meet the unique learning needs of every student, ensuring no one is left behind on their educational journey.
* Create and champion an inclusive environment where students are valued; fostering a sense of belonging within our vibrant educational community.
* Collaborate with an ICS co-teacher to ensure student success.
* Provide consistent communication with families about student progress.
* Lead by example, demonstrating your passion for learning and instilling it in our students, nurturing their growth and development.
* Promote and participate in our shared learning community through our professional development opportunities
* If uncertified, attend a graduate course program (through our partnership with Monroe College or elsewhere) that prepares you to obtain your Standard Teaching Certification and become a highly qualified teacher.

**Experience:**

* A “whatever it takes” attitude, one that is centered in the notion of “children first.”
* Belief in every students’ limitless potential.
* A Bachelor's degree in a science field, Education, and/or MA in a relevant field.
* Teacher certification (preferred) in the state of New York, or ability to work toward certification and pass the state licensure exam.
* Exhibit patience, empathy, and the ability to motivate students toward their full potential.
* Possess exceptional communication skills, empowering you to convey complex ideas in relatable terms.
* Collaborative attitude toward teaching and learning.
* Embrace and celebrate diversity, creating an inclusive classroom environment that reflects the dynamic nature of our community.

**Perks & Benefits:**

* Unique class model: 18-20 students, all co-taught classes;
* Weekly Wednesday ½ day schedule for embedded professional development and planning.
* Ongoing professional development, training and embedded coaching to continually evolve on your educational journey.
* Tuition reimbursement
* Teaching certification pathway for those who qualify.
* Opportunity to be an integral part of our community, making a genuine difference and shaping the futures of our students.
* Students of ICS employees have access to after-care options.
* Free parking on-campus.

**ICS is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Clinical Research Data Product Manager
description:
Biotrial is a leading Contract Research Organization (CRO) specializing in Drug Development with a wide range of expertise in preclinical pharmacology, clinical development, bioanalysis, biometrics and ECG, and CNS and Imaging Core Lab. With over 30 years of experience in providing scientific and medical services in clinical development, Biotrial offers innovative, tailor-made solutions to Biotech and Pharmaceutical companies. By joining our Company in one of our locations in Europe or America, you become part of a high-performing organization and teams. Teamwork and cooperation between departments allow us to offer state-of-the-art services. You will therefore be required to interact in a supportive manner with different departments.

We are seeking a clinical **Data Manager Project Manager** to join our team. In this position, you will be the main contact for the sponsors of our studies and the project team set up (data managers, statisticians, clinical project managers, clinical research associates, etc.).

Responsibilities of the **Data Manager Project Manager M/F**:

* Participation in the implementation of studies.
* Drafting the CRF and the Data-Management specifications.
* Participation in the data review meeting.
* Implementation of e-FIUs.
* Tracking of input, external data loading, data validation, coding.
* Drafting and monitoring of the documentation from the data management plan to the Data-Management report before the freeze of the database.
* Monitoring compliance with deadlines in agreement with the Director of the Data-Management Unit.
* Participation in the updating of procedures.

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor's degree required, preferably in a scientific discipline or equivalent experience, Master’s preferred.
* A minimum of five (5) years’ experience in Data Manager and/ or Product Manager, with expertise in clinical trials.
* Proven experience in Biotech/ Pharmaceutical Industry
* Proficient knowledge of ICH, GCP, GLP and applicable CFRs, guidance documents, systems processes, and procedures.
* Experience in clinical operations and handling trial essential documents is preferred.

**Skills and Abilities**

* Excellent communication and negotiation skills, and enjoys working with people and information, making decisions, problem-solving, making a difference and working in a leadership role.
* Adheres to ethical and good clinical practices and the ability to work as part of a team, as well as work independently.
* Excellent organizational skills and the ability to successfully work on multiple projects with competitive timelines.
* Strong attention to detail and respect for the accuracy of information with a solid commitment to maintaining high-quality standards.
* Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication, organizational skills.
* Exceptional analytical and mathematics skills required.
* Must be able to travel (25%) including the potential for international travel.
* Intermediate to advanced software skills (e.g., Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Project).
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Ability to analyze information and solve problems relating to all processes within a clinical research environment.

*Biotrial is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Skills Trainer Middlesex County
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Mileage reimbursement for all work related travel
* 20-days accrued PTO & 12-14 paid holidays
* Employee Referral Bonus Program
* Company paid Life & Disability Insurance plans
* Supportive work environment
* Laptop, tablet and cell phone provided
* Paid training through College of Direct Supports & Boggs Center
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Training & development
* Vision insurance
* Wellness resources

  

**We are currently hiring for a Pre-Employment Skills Trainer to work with high school students with disabilities in Middlesex County.**  

  

Since 1996, Waters & Sims Employment Services has provided Supported Employment services to those with barriers to employment in Monmouth, Ocean & Middlesex counties. We are passionate about raising the bar of employment options and opportunities for our consumers and seek a person who shares this passion. Our employees excel at supporting their consumers in securing competitive integrative employment and providing ongoing, long-term support to foster independence. A very rewarding career experience!  

  

Supporting our Pre-Employment and Training Services Program (Pre-ETS) you would be working with Special Services departments in local high schools by working with their students in preparing them for employment. All New Jersey students with disabilities ages 14 through 21 who are either 1) eligible for special education; 2) receiving accommodations under Section 504; or 3) have a medically documented disability, and intend to pursue employment, can request needed Pre-ETS services. The Federal law known as the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA) requires State vocational rehabilitation agencies to set aside at least 15% of their federal funds to provide Pre-Employment Transition Services (Pre-ETS) to students with disabilities to prepare them for competitive integrated employment. Skills Trainers will work one-on-one in a classroom or virtual setting with a student during their high school years to engage and instruct the student in the five Pre-ETS components. Using a variety of assessments, career exploration, and workplace learning experiences the students’ interests, skills, abilities, and aptitudes are discovered. Curriculum development to achieve the desired outcome of the five Pre-ETS components is an important responsibility of this position. Coordinating referrals from the Department of Vocational Rehabilitation Services and local high schools, as well as community outreach to high schools and local employers will be a vital part of this position.  

  

As a **Skills Trainer**, you will be working with students by instructing/training them in the following five components to help prepare them for competitive integrative employment:  

  

***1. Job Exploration Counseling/Assessments***  

  

***2. Counseling on Post Secondary Education Options***  

  

***3. Workplace Learning experience (volunteer work experience and/or unsubsidized employment)***  

  

***4. Workplace Readiness Training to develop social skills and independent living***  

  

***5. Instruction in Self Advocacy***  

  

**Successful applicants must:**  

  

* Bachelor’s Degree required in Counseling, Psychology , Social Work, Special Education or related field.
* Live within Monmouth County and be willing to travel throughout the county as needed using your own vehicle (mileage reimbursed)
* Have excellent time management skills
* Be flexible
* Be able to juggle multiple projects at once
* Have strong problem-solving skills
* Have strong verbal and written skills
* Feel comfortable job developing in person and on the phone with potential employers
* Be able to provide strong advocacy and coaching skills
* Be able to work independently, position is in the community and NOT a desk job
* Have a strong desire to help consumers reach their full potential by preparing for the workforce after they graduate from school

  

**This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:**  

  

* Achievement-oriented - enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail
* Autonomous/Independent - enjoys working with little direction
* Detail-oriented - would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
* Innovative - prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity
* Dependable - more reliable than spontaneous
* People-oriented - enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects
* Adaptable/flexible - enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction

title: Full-Time/Part-Time Attorneys
description:
Hoagland, Longo, Moran, Dunst & Doukas, LLP is a full-service law firm committed to success, and provides a culture of professional excellence through a team of high caliber employees. We offer a hybrid work schedule and are seeking full-time and part-time attorneys to join our team.

Positions offer a high degree of responsibility and client contact. Experience in civil litigation and general liability with trial experience and/or employment law & public entity defense is preferred. Admission to the New Jersey Bar is required and additional admission to New York is preferred. Experience writing briefs and strong writing skills are required, and trial experience is a plus.

All full-time attorneys are eligible for excellent comprehensive benefits including; health, dental, life insurance, disability and FSA.

**Company Benefits & Perks for all Attorneys include:**

* Hybrid work schedules\\*
* Comprehensive health insurance coverage (including dental and vision)
* Life and disability insurance
* Flexible spending accounts for both health and child care expenses
* 401(K) with 10% company match\\*
* Discounted gym membership at RWJ Fitness & Wellness Centers\\*
* Company events - annual family picnic, holiday party, fitness/wellness challenges, etc.\\*
* Continuing learning and development\\*

\\*Select benefits/perks are offered to part-time attorneys as well.

Please submit a cover lever and references along with your resume.

title: Assistant Project Manager
description:

title: Manager, Finance
description:
**ABOUT THE NATIONAL HOCKEY LEAGUE**  

Founded in 1917, the National Hockey League (NHL®) is the premier professional ice hockey league in the world, and is one of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada.  

  

With more than 1500 employees across the US and Canada, the NHL is a global sports and entertainment organization committed to building healthy and vibrant communities using the sport of hockey to celebrate fans of every race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and socio-economic status.  

  

At the NHL, we are looking for dynamic, energetic and impactful individuals who are committed to doing the same by sharing in our philosophy that Hockey is for Everyone – and inclusion belongs on the ice, in the locker rooms, boardrooms and stands.
  

**WHAT WE EXPECT OF YOU**  

  

**SUMMARY**  

This Manager of Finance position will be responsible for overseeing all financial tasks associated with the Consumer Products licensing business for assigned contracts.  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
The manager will be responsible for the following tasks:* Manage all financial aspects of the Consumer Products business for assigned retail and premium licensees
* Oversee processing of royalties reported
* Communicate with retail and premium licensees regarding royalty reports, payments, and any issues that arise
* Manage open receivables for assigned retail and premium licensees
* Coordinate with the Legal and Consumer Products teams to review contracts and amendments associated with assigned retail licensees
* Coordinate with the Club Business, Partnership Marketing, and Legal teams to review contracts associated with premium licensees
* Review financial results for assigned retail licensees, including data presented on Consumer Products dashboards in Tagetik/Qlik
* Assist with analyzing variance to budget/forecast and commentaries for senior management
* Coordinate with the Consumer Products team regarding any ad hoc analyses for assigned licensees and lines of business
* Prepare support for year-end financial statement audits
* Manage royalty analyst assigned to licensees
* Work with the Consumer Products team to establish budgets and forecasts for assigned licensees
* Perform ad hoc special projects

  

**QUALIFICATIONS**  

**Knowledge Areas/Experience****Required*** Extensive knowledge of the revenue recognition, accounting processes and the accounts receivable cycle
* 3+ years of experience with royalty-based revenue and related contracts

**Preferred*** Experience with business analytics tools a plus. Tagetik/Qlik preferred
* Experience with consumer products licensing and RightsLogic a plus

 **Education/Certifications*** Minimum of Bachelors in Accounting or Finance

 **Required Skills*** Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
* Excellent verbal and written skills
* Able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously
* Strong analytical and organizational skills and able to solve problems
* Take initiative and develop creative solutions to issues.

 **CORE COMPETENCIES**  

These core competencies reflect the underlying values that are necessary to represent the National Hockey League:* *Accountability*
* *Adaptability*
* *Communication*
* *Critical Thinking*
* *Inclusion*
* *Professionalism*
* *Teamwork & Collaboration*

  

**The NHL offers U.S. regular, full-time employees:****Time to Recharge**: Utilize our generous Paid Time Off (PTO) to focus on your well-being and ensure a healthy work/life balance. PTO includes paid holidays, vacation, personal and sick days, plus an extra day off for your birthday.**Ability to Focus on your Health:** Along with competitive salaries, the NHL offers comprehensive health benefits to employees and their eligible dependents effective on their first day with us – there is no waiting period. The NHL subsidizes a large portion of the health benefits costs, therefore your cost for medical, dental and vision coverage is minimal.
We also offer our employees and members of their household access to our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to support mental, physical, and financial health. In addition, employees have access to a digital wellness resource designed to improve health and happiness through courses in sleep, movement, and focus. These services are confidential and at no-cost to our employees.**Childcare Leave:** Because your family is the NHL family, employees are offered comprehensive Childcare Leave to welcome your new addition. The primary caregiver to the child is entitled to up to 12 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.

Employees that are not the primary caregiver to the child are entitled to up to 6 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, which must be taken within the first 6 months following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.**Confidence in your Retirement Goals:** Participate in the NHL’s Savings Plan which includes a 401K(pre-tax and Roth options) plus non-elective (employer) contributions to keep your retirement goals on track.**A Hybrid Work Schedule**: The NHL recognizes the value of flexibility in work locations/schedules to help our employees balance work/life priorities. Hybrid work schedules are available for a majority of our roles.**Our New Headquarters:** Our new, state of the art, offices are located at One Manhattan West in Hudson Yards. When you’re in the office, you can conduct meetings in one of our high-tech conference rooms, have lunch with a view or play in the game room. Employees can also enjoy New York’s newest neighborhood that is home to more than 100 shops, culinary experiences, and public artwork.**A Savings for Commuting:** Participate in the NHL’s pre-tax commuter benefit plan whichhelps offset the financial cost of traveling to and from our office.**NHL Partner Rates:** Unlock exclusive pricing from our Partners that include savings on travel, consumer goods and services, plus the NHL Store.**Life at the NHL:** In your first few days, you meet with your new teammates and the HR Team. You have the opportunity to learn more about the NHL and our workplace culture. Employees are invited to play hockey during our Tuesday Night Skate at Chelsea Piers, join our Employee Resource Groups and more. You are a part of our team and we encourage you to be your authentic self, adding to our dynamic workplace culture.**SALARY RANGE:**
 $90-100K

Actual base pay for a successful candidate will be determined based on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to: experience/training, market demands, and geographic location.**When applying, please be sure to include a cover letter with your salary expectations for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, however only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. NO EMAILS OR PHONE CALLS PLEASE.**

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Counter Associate
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking an Associate to join our team. As an Associate, you will play a crucial role in providing excellent customer service and ensuring the smooth operation of our establishment. Your main responsibilities will include assisting customers, handling cash transactions, maintaining cleanliness and food safety standards, and supporting the overall efficiency of our operations.

Duties:

- Provide exceptional customer service by greeting and assisting customers in a friendly and professional manner.  
- Operate cash registers and handle cash transactions accurately.  
- Upsell products and promotions to maximize sales opportunities.  
- Maintain cleanliness and sanitation standards in all areas of the establishment, including the kitchen and dining areas.  
- Follow food safety protocols to ensure the safe handling and preparation of food items.  
- Assist with food preparation tasks as needed.  
- Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth workflow and efficient operations.  
- Perform basic math calculations to accurately process transactions and provide correct change.  
- Manage time effectively to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.

Skills:

- Strong customer service skills with a friendly and approachable demeanor.  
- Ability to effectively communicate with customers and team members.  
- Basic math skills for cash handling and transaction processing.  
- Excellent time management skills to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.  
- Familiarity with operating cash registers or point-of-sale systems.  
- Knowledge of food safety regulations and practices.  
- Ability to work in a team-oriented environment.

Join our team as an Associate and contribute to creating a positive experience for our customers while gaining valuable skills in customer service, cash handling, and food safety. Apply now!

Must be Authorized to work in the USA

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
SUMMARY: Under limited supervision, performs a variety of semi-skilled work in the maintenance of Convenience Stores and Gasoline Stations; and performs related duties as assigned.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Troubleshoots minor maintenance problems involving electrical, structural, plumbing, and equipment repair or replacement.

Performs preventive building maintenance duties, caulks windows and doors, repairs and replaces broken windows.

Performs routine plumbing repairs such as unstopping toilets, sinks or urinals, fixing water leaks, leaking faucets, and water fountains.

Performs routine electrical repairs such as changing light bulbs or fluorescent lamps and assists in repairing ballast and light fixtures.

Purchases supplies, equipment, and materials necessary to complete projects.

Assembles and moves furniture, hangs signage and bulletin boards, moves and sets up tables and chairs, cabinets, and C-Store equipment as required.

Repairs and replaces door knobs or locks, repairs door closures, patches holes in walls.

Paints interior and exterior walls, curbs, canopies, parking lots and other areas as necessary.

Pressure wash walls, canopies, curbs and other areas on premises as needed

Perform certain grounds maintenance that may include cleaning, weeding, mowing, trimming, weed-wacking, pruning trees and shrubs

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of trades related to building maintenance and repair.

Knowledge of a variety of building maintenance procedures and techniques.

Knowledge of machinery, equipment, and tools necessary for the maintenance and repair of buildings.

Knowledge of occupational hazards and safety precautions.

Skill in reading and following assembly instructions.

Skills in following safety practices and recognizing hazards.

Skill in using hand and power tools.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with CPD staff and the public.

Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.

Ability to organize, prioritize work schedule and maintain required work logs and service requests

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT: Work involves moderate to heavy work in all types of weather. There is frequent need to stand, stoop, walk, lift heavy objects (up to 50 pounds) and perform other similar actions during the course of the workday. CPD promotes a drug/alcohol free work environment through the use of periodic and random drug testing.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/WORK LOCATION: High School diploma or GED and one (5) years building maintenance experience, or any equivalent combination of training and experience. A clean driving record and valid CT driver’s license is required. Must be willing to drive a company provided vehicle to locations throughout Fairfield, Hartford, New Haven counties in CT and Upper Westchester County in NY with other areas as needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00 to $25.00 /hour

title: Dementia Program Assistant
description:
Dementia Program Assistant

The Dementia Day Program serves adults diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease and related

disorders providing social and recreational activities at our Oceanside location. The Dementia

Program Assistant is responsible for leading stage-appropriate activities, using video

conferencing equipment and ensuring compliance with health and safety protocols. This part-

time position reports to the Director of Dementia Programs & Services.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

-Plan and lead appropriate activities including discussions, games, arts & crafts to meet care plan goals

-Create and maintain an engaging, respectful, and welcoming environment that is sanitized, clean and

organized

- Provide competent and direct supervision of adults with cognitive impairment; treating them with

dignity, respect and compassion

-Prioritize safety at all times

-Ensure compliance of JCC policies and NYSOFA guidelines

-Maintain daily attendance records

-Monitor status of each participant and log and report if necessary

-Report incident/occurrence to Dementia Program Director immediately

-Assist with personal care as needed

-Cue and provide one-on-one support as needed so that each individual’s level of participation is

maximized and are able to benefit from the program

-Provide reassurance and support to caregivers at arrival and dismissal

-Complete all required trainings to maintain competency in working with the Dementia population

Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no supervisory responsibilities

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: This is a 15 hour part time position. Required Education

and Experience: Previous experience working with older adults with Alzheimer’s disease or

related dementia

Minimum of H.S. Diploma or G.E.D., certification as a Certified Nurse Aide (CNA), Home Health

Aide (HHA), Personal Care Aide (PCA) or Therapeutic Recreation Assistant preferred.

Knowledge and Skills:

 Demonstrated competency in written, verbal and computational skills to present and

document records in accordance with program standards.

 Ability to use video-conferencing technology and to troubleshoot when necessary

 Creativity

 Patience and a sense of humor

Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a

comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee

for this job. Duties, responsibilities and

activities may change at any time with or without notice.

For consideration, please contact Pam Jaffe at 516-634-4192 or pjaffe@friedbergjcc.org

title: Superintendent / Commercial Retail Construction
description:
**Position:** Traveling Superintendent

**Location:** Queens and Long Island

**Position Reports to:** General Superintendent

**Company Overview**

Vericon Construction Company is a premier full-service Construction Management & General Contracting firm dedicated to building high quality spaces, structures and relationships. Vericon is headquartered in Mountainside, NJ with offices in DC Metro, FL and NC. **We are looking for a qualified Superintendent in Queens or Long Island.**

**Position Objectives and Responsibilities**

**Typical Projects**

* Ground Up Retail
* Commercial and Office Space Renovations
* Interior/Exterior Refreshes
* Restacks

**General Responsibilities**

* Responsible for management of construction projects
* Manage the day-to-day field activities to ensure that the project milestone dates and overall schedule completion dates are met
* Creating short-interval look-ahead project schedules to make sure that upcoming events are communicated and tracked
* Maintain a daily log of job site activities, timesheets, and e-mails
* Responsible for client satisfaction, project quality, and cost control
* Conform to applicable corporate policies, procedures, and ethical standards
* Communicate regularly with Property Managers, subcontractors, suppliers, and others
* Interact with other various staff members to obtain support and resources
* Managing and coordinating the work to ensure that it is constructed in a manner that is consistent with the contract documents and/or scope of work
* Verifying that all work is installed in a workmanlike manner
* Obtaining all required inspections
* Ensuring all aspects of the physical work are fully documented, including red line drawings
* Managing changes in project scope and ensure that the project manager knows of them
* Managing the punch list to assure timely completion
* Conduct weekly job site/safety meetings with all engaged subcontractors
* Provide consistent feedback and reports to project team
* Other duties as required

**Position Requirements and Qualifications**

**REQUIRED SKILLS:** Must have excellent communication skills both orally and in writing. Must be computer literate and capable of using MS Word, Excel and iPad/laptop. This position requires an individual that is confident, energetic, and has leadership skills. Must be able follow the direction of the project manager and/or the senior project manager with a direct reporting relationship to the General Superintendent.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* 5+ years' experience in commercial/building construction
* Familiar with ground up retail construction projects
* OSHA Trained, required
* Must be highly organized and efficient
* Able to perform hands-on work with limited time at a desk
* Attention to detail and a self-starter will be a requirement
* Able to handle a wide variety of obligations during any given day
* Must be willing to travel, work after hours, and nights/weekends
* Great people skills and a positive attitude will also be an attribute of the perfect candidate

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Night shift

title: High School Social Studies Teacher
description:
Chaminade High School seeks a **full-time Social Studies** teacher starting January 6, 2025.

**About Chaminade High School**  
Chaminade High School has served the Long Island community since its founding in 1930. The school is owned and operated by the Society of Mary, the Marianists, and is named after Blessed William Joseph Chaminade. Blessed Chaminade founded the order as a priest working to evangelize post-revolutionary France.

Our 1,600 men study a rigorous liberal arts curriculum in an atmosphere that emphasizes the development of Christian community and education of the heart. That program consists of four years of English, Mathematics, Religion, Science, Social Studies, and Physical Education; three years of World Language and Fine Arts; and one year of Health. Chaminade graduates are fully prepared for the most demanding of college curricula, and each year, 100% of Chaminade graduates attend colleges, universities, prep schools, and service academies.

More than 90% of Chaminade students are engaged in one or more school activities, and more than half participate in interscholastic athletic teams.

**Social Studies Teacher**

The Social Studies Department at Chaminade High School prioritizes modern, student-driven instructional practices that challenge students to develop as critical thinkers and skilled writers. In addition to teaching responsibilities, Chaminade faculty members coordinate a robust after-school program of extracurricular and co-curricular clubs and activities.

Requirements

* NYS Certification Social Studies 7-12
* Relevant Master's Degree (completed or in the process)
* Experience teaching AP Macroeconomics

title: Jr Investment Analyst / Trader
description:
**NOTE: ONLY APPLY IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR A JUNIOR** **POSITION AT AN INVESTMENT FUND. MID AND SENIOR ROLES WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED AT THIS TIME.**

**College students are also welcome to apply for an internship role.**

PLEASE UPLOAD YOUR RESUME **IN PDF FORMAT ONLY**. Resumes in Word format will be ignored. So will applications where candidates do not answer the screening questions.

**Job Description**

One candidate is wanted by a small, multi-strategy, hedge fund in the vicinity of New York City (Connecticut) for the following position:

***Jr Investment Analyst*** */* ***Trader***

To join a team of 7, reporting directly to the Portfolio Manager.

The role requires a flexible approach to tasks as the candidate will help out with both the analyst and trading teams.

Candidates are expected to support the teams in:

* Gathering intelligence and developing quantitative and qualitative analysis to uncover key insights about target investments in public and private markets.
* Reviewing, analyzing, modeling and generating valuation data and market reports. Evaluating and summarizing portfolio company, industry, sponsor, and valuation metrics on investment opportunities.
* Contributing to alternative data gathering and processing. Some assignment travel is to be expected.
* Examining and assessing economic and market trends, earnings prospects, financial statements and various other indicators and factors to determine suitable investment strategies.
* Liaising with fellow team members and performing in-depth due diligence in order to arrive at a final recommendation on trading opportunities;
* Screening investment opportunities, contributing to due diligence and monitor existing investments. Monitoring financial press closely and keeping a track of market trends, opportunities, risks and new investment products.
* Developing solutions to analytical problems independently.

**Candidate Requirements**

* A strong passion for investment in financial markets.
* Excellent analytical AND communication skills.
* Ability to think outside-the-box, adapting to alternative and unorthodox strategies if the situation requires it. Non-consensus views are welcomed.
* Ability to develop a thoughtful investment thesis.
* Interest in idea generation.
* Have at least one of the following:

- CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst)  
- CFOA (Certified Futures and Options Analyst)  
- Completed TrendUp Now Program Level 3 AND the TrendUp SRP track (*i.e. TrendUp's career program for participants who have demonstrated excellent performance)*

* In possession -or currently pursuing for internship applicants- a degree in Finance, Business, Economics or Accounting. Degrees in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering and similar quant fields are also welcome. Exceptional candidates with more unorthodox backgrounds may also be considered on a case-by-case basis.
* 2+ years of relevant Finance / Investment experience.
* Be eligible to work in the United States of America.
* Please note that strong preference will be given to candidates who have graduated from the TrendUp Now L-program.

Base salary range does not include overtime pay, bonus and/or other benefits, where applicable. Actual base salary offer will vary based on skills and experience.

**Note for TrendUp SRP graduates**: You may be contacted directly in the next few weeks by our Recruitment team if your profile is a good fit for this role. There is no need to apply to through this page.

company: New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
description:
**Celebrating 50 years of excellence, New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (NYPCC) has been at the forefront of mental health and wellness; assisting children, families, and individuals with behavioral and emotional challenges at our five locations throughout the city.**

**NYPCC is the leading pioneer of community mental health services, serving over 15,000 clients per month. We run and operate the largest clinic in the State of New York and pride ourselves on innovation and “caring for the community” by providing in-person and telehealth services for our clients, while offering an unsurpassable and competitive compensation structure and benefits package to our team of dedicated employees.**

**NYPCC is certified by Mental Health America as a Platinum Bell Seal organization, the highest certification possible. NYPCC is proud of our ongoing commitment to employee mental health and well-being.** 

**Why Work at NYPCC:**

* We Pay Down Your Student Loans!
* Productivity Bonus
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance is Paid for by NYPCC 100%
* Paid Time Off and Company Paid Holidays
* Annual Rate Increases
* 403B Retirement Plan
* Professional Development through NYPCC Academy
* Amazing Workplace Culture

**Responsibilities:**

* General office responsibilities (answer phones/take messages, scan, fax and copy, etc.)
* Schedule appointments
* Greet/direct clients and visitors upon arrival
* Check clients in and out on electronic health record system
* File documents in patient charts
* Coordinate drop-offs and pickups of transportation services
* Provide support to the clinical team and chart maintenance
* Maintain confidentiality and comply with HIPPA regulations
* Perform other related duties as assigned by the Office Manager and Program Administrator

**Qualifications:**

* Must be Bilingual in English and Spanish
* High School Diploma or equivalent is required
* 1 to 2 years of Reception experience in a fast paced office, preferably in medical or community mental health office, is required
* Must be proficient in MS Office (Outlook, Word, and Excel)
* Must have the ability to learn new software
* Possesses the personality and demeanor to work with difficult clients
* Must be detail-oriented and have the ability to multi-task
* Must be a team player
* Thrives under pressure in an outpatient client environment
* 1 form of picture ID (non-expired)
* Unexpired passport: OR
* Driver’s License AND Social Security Card; OR
* State ID Card AND Social Security Card

**Additional Information**

* The ideal candidate for this position possesses a personal presence characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and care with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the mission, vision, goals, and values NYPCC
* Has the ability to self-care and cope with mental and emotional stress related to the position, function independently, have flexibility, consistency, and professionalism
* Can develop and sustain safe, positive, and productive work habits and demonstrate compliance with NYPCC policies and procedures

***NYPCC is a fast-paced, energetic, dynamic environment that employs people with a passion for our mission.***

***NYPCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer***

***Compensation commensurate with experience and qualifications.***

description:
Seeking NYS Licensed Psychologists (PhD. or Psy. D) in the Long Island and 5 boroughs of NYC.

**Job Descriptions:**

* Ongoing need for Psychologists with diverse backgrounds and experiences (Ph.D or Psy D) multiple opportunities to partner with NYTPS Inc.
* Immediate need for Psychologists in all areas for In-Person and Telehealth visits.
* Immediate need for bilingual Psychologists.
* This is a contract position.

**Options for partnering with NYTPS Inc.:**

You could conduct psychological evaluations and social history updates with p**reschool students** and their families. These multidisciplinary evaluations MDE's are authorized by the NYC Department of Education-CPSE.

You could conduct Neuropsychological and Psychoeducational evaluations with s**chool-aged students**. NYTPS Inc. is an approved provider of school age monolingual and bilingual evaluations under contract with the New York State Education Department and with the NYC Department of Education. We are also a provider of Independent Education Evaluations which are the result of due process.

You could provide counseling services to preschool and school-age populations in public and private school/home settings.

You could join our network of providers for Out Patient Mental Health services via Insurance. This position includes providing individual and group therapy sessions via Telehealth or your existing office.

NYS Licensed Psychologist (PhD or Psy D)

New York Therapy Placement Services, Inc. has been a leader in the educational/healthcare services arena for over 30 years. Founded in 1986, the company plays an integral part in both the public and private health care sectors. NYTPS is a multidisciplinary agency, with placements available for Occupational Therapists, Physical Therapists, Speech Language Pathologists, LCSW's, LMHC's, Psychologists (PHD and PsyD), School Psychologists and Special Education Teachers and Behavior Analysts. Our placements include a wide variety of setting such as, but not limited to, preschools, schools, home care, nursing homes, long and short term care facilities. We are proud of our reputation of excellence and commitment to providing services in compliance with local, state and federal guidelines. We pride ourselves in working with only the most experienced clinicians that are interested in making a difference in the lives of others.

title: Temporary Case Manager OASAS (CoC)
description:
***Who is Bridging Access to Care, Inc.:*** *Bridging Access to Care, Inc. (BAC) is a nonprofit, multi-service, community-based behavioral health care organization committed to building healthy communities, one person at a time.*

*In 2012, Brooklyn Aids Task Force changed its name to BAC and successfully made the transition from an AIDS-centered organization to a multi-service community-based healthcare organization. Brooklyn Aids Task Force was the very first HIV/AIDS organization in Brooklyn prioritizing serving persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) since 1986. Today, BAC provides mental health and substance use-related social services, comprehensive HIV/AIDS care, and coordinated health care and supportive services to under-served racial and ethnic minority communities in the Brooklyn and other parts of New York City.*

*Bridging Access to Care, Inc. offers a competitive salary package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and opportunities for professional development.*

JOB SUMMARY: BAC is looking for a motivated Case Manager. The Case Manager will be working with a team providing wrap-around services to OASAS Continuum of Care (CoC) program. Case Manager will be responsible for, but not limited to intake, continuous assessment, and supportive case management for clients living in scatter-site apartments.

EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCES:

· Minimum: HS Diploma or equivalent with 2+ years of field experience providing housing and/or case management services to homeless populations, people with substance use disorders, and/or people with psychiatric illness.

· Preferred: Bachelor's degree in social work, Human Services, or related field

· Minimum: One (1) year of experience providing housing and/or case management services to homeless populations, people with substance use disorders, and/or people with psychiatric illness *strongly preferred*.

SCHEDULE: Monday 9am - 5pm(with some flexibility), Tuesday - Friday 8am - 6pm

*Temp role to conclude either April or August, 2025.* 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Coordinates move-in for new clients and relocation for existing clients when necessary

· Assists clients with establishing utility services and monitoring monthly payments to ensure utilities are not disconnected for non-payment.

· Conducts intake assessments, quarterly re-assessments, monthly (at minimum) home visits, and develops and implements initial, annual, and quarterly service plans with each client on caseload of 20-25.

· Complete DLA-20, Trauma Screening, and other mandatory agency forms in a timely manner.

Monitor clients' progress toward their goals via regularly scheduled home visits and telephone contact, and document visits via progress notes.

· Work with clients to break through barriers to service goals and to assist clients in advocating for themselves and in moving toward self-sufficiency.

· Calculates, collects, and tracks monthly rent payments from each client to ensure each client makes appropriate monthly rent payments and manages delinquencies as appropriate.

· Assist clients receiving public assistance with completing and submitting through SSI/SSDI application packet using the SOAR model.

· Resolve all apartment repair/maintenance needs via BAC maintenance staff and advocacy with clients’ superintendents, building managers, and landlords.

· Participate in internal and external case conferences.

Utilize person center approach and motivational interviewing to aid clients to meet their prioritized needs.

· Other related duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

· Excellent organizational and record-keeping skills, as well as the ability to manage multiple cases

· Knowledge of issues related to substance use, recovery, and mental health.

· Excellent computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Teams, Excel) and the ability to learn new programs.

· Familiarity with electronic medical records (EMR).

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Cost Accountant (Hybrid)
description:
**Title: Cost Accountant (Hybrid)**

**Location: Perth Amboy, NJ 08861**

**Duration: Direct hire**

**Direct Client**

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Cost Accountant / Business Analyst to join our team. This role plays a crucial part in our financial operations by providing valuable insights into cost management and business performance. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in cost accounting and a passion for analyzing financial data to drive strategic decisions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

· Maintain and update standard costing data within the ERP system including new items and monthly/quarterly/annual cost rolls.

· Monitor and assess all cost elements such as raw material, paint, packaging, scrap, labor and overhead to ensure standard costs are accurately calculated and costed for each product.

· Investigate, analyze, and monitor variances between budgeted, standard, and actual costs; identifying root causes and recommend corrective actions.

· Support the quoting process by providing estimated cost and price for new products timely and efficiently.

· Update item prices as needed per pricing review approvals.

· Provide assistance to the accounting and finance department as needed such as forecasting, analysis, and reporting.

· Execute assigned steps related to month end close. Ensure tasks are performed in a timely and quality manner.

· Perform account reconciliations as assigned. Address reconciling items in a timely manner and perform root-cause analysis.

· Periodically assess inventory for risk (e.g. Excess and Obsolete), make recommendations for reserve levels or other action steps

· Interact with external auditors and address audit requests in a timely manner

**Qualifications:**

· Bachelor’s degree in accounting/finance

· Proven experience in cost accounting and financial analysis – minimum of 4 years.

· Familiarity with standard costing, manufacturing variances and inventory absorption

· Strong knowledge of Lower of Cost of Market and other key GAAP concepts related to inventory.

· CPA a plus.

· Excellent interpersonal, organizational, verbal, and written communication skills are required.

· Exceptional customer service skills and the ability to work with all levels of staff is required.

· Ability to perform duties in a professional and ethical manner.

· The ability to maintain strict confidentiality of information is required.

Job posting is for immediate hire, must be available weekends and after school during the school year but hours do change during the summer.

Responsibilities include: Meet and greet customers to explain the pottery painting process and studio information. Provide customers with design assistance and helpful tips. Answer telephones, book parties and events, ring up sales, and process special orders. Perform housekeeping duties such as table set-up/clean-up, washing brushes and pallets, vacuuming, unpacking inventory, restocking and cleaning shelves on an ongoing basis.

Ideal candidate likes working with both kids and adults, painting skills are a perk but not a must. Salary starts at $13 plus tips.

title: Warehouse Production & Delivery Driver
description:
Great opportunity for growth in an expanding and exciting company!  
World of Coffee is seeking a reliable and responsible individual to perform general plant duties. We are willing to train the right person to learn and grow with our company.

World of Coffee is a family-owned full-service specialty coffee roasting company known for our premium quality and popular coffee products. World of Coffee has been growing exponentially in recent years and we are looking to expand our team. Come join our family and become a valued member of our growing team!

Job Functions & Responsibilities:

* Gather, prepare, package, and complete orders
* Handle inbound/outbound freight, label boxes, handle materials
* Use pallet jack and/or forklift to move material
* Control inventory levels by conducting physical counts
* Receive and process warehouse stock products
* Operate and maintain warehouse equipment
* Deliver goods to customers in NJ and NY using company vehicle
* Keep a clean and safe work environment by following organization standards and sanitation regulations
* Ensure all working and common areas are kept clean and organized
* Practice food and plant safety rules and standards
* Communicate and cooperate with supervisors and coworkers
* Assist in product quality control
* Demonstrate mastery of responsibilities and ability to work self-sufficiently
* Learn and retain product knowledge and specifications
* Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related tasks as needed

Qualifications:

* Must be able to work Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 4:30pm
* Ability to lift up to 70 LBS
* Valid Driver’s License with clean driving record
* Familiar and comfortable driving around New York and New Jersey
* Punctual, reliable, responsible, trustworthy, and flexible
* Desire to learn and adapt to changing situations
* Able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously
* Knowledge in warehouse operations and equipment (forklift, inventory management, etc)
* Team player, self-starter, and motivated individual with a willingness to learn and follow direction
* Completes tasks efficiently and accurately
* Good organization and time management skills
* Deadline oriented
* Strong attention to detail
* Must be able to work in all temperatures
* Food Safety and Current Good Manufacturing Practices (CGMPs) knowledge/experience/training a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

title: Email Marketing & Social Media Specialist
description:
**Estimated starting salary is $1147-$1434 per week.**


**Job Specifications:**


* At least 2-4 years of relevant experience
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing or related field
* Experience preferred with Marketing Automation email platform
* Excellent understanding of email execution, concepts and metrics, deliverability and best practices, email marketing trends, technologies, and privacy laws
* Excellent knowledge of leveraging social media channels for effective marketing efforts, including but not limited to LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube
* Experience managing vendors and agencies
* Strong communication and problem-solving skills
* Financial services/banking marketing background strongly preferred
* Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Creative Suite and other software applications in the Windows environment
* Knowledge of and experience with tracking and analytics tools;
* Team player that is reliable, flexible, helpful and works well in a collaborative environment
* Detail-oriented, superior organizational and project management skills
* Fast learner, highly motivated, self-starter and creative
* Client-centric and service oriented positive attitude

  


**Duties and Responsibilities Include:**


**Email:**


* Be the owner and subject matter expert (SME)of the Bank’s email marketing channel
* Manage multiple simultaneous email campaigns from start to finish, including planning, launching, evaluating, and reporting; factor learnings to optimize next set of campaigns
* Collaborate with the marketing team and business units to understand email needs for multi-channel marketing campaigns, onboarding, and engagement journeys
* Monitor and report performance of email marketing campaigns with clear KPIs and adjust strategy of underperforming campaigns
* Act as the in-house expert for email tools such as Marketing Automation platform to ensure the smooth functioning of the email marketing program
* Develop ongoing strategies to optimize for email performance and conversions

  


**Social Media**


* Be the owner and SME of the Bank’s social media marketing channel (using Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn, Blogs and more as developed), responsible for ensuring social media is leveraged appropriately and successfully as part of marketing, brand awareness and engagement efforts
* Work with supervisor and social media agency to design and implement a social media strategy that is aligned with business objectives and drives measurable business results
* Report on the effectiveness of the social media marketing program, both organic and paid, by outlining clear KPIs
* Monitor social media community engagement to protect brand reputation and to identify emerging issues that could impact the brand
* Create and execute social media marketing campaigns

  


**General Marketing Responsibilities:**


* Create digital content related to the company's services and products for posting on the website, social media, and through e-mail campaigns and other channels to drive brand awareness and engagement.
* Effectively communicate the features and benefits of the Bank’s products and services through the design and development of all marketing communications utilizing current computer graphic software applications.
* Interact with Departments/Branches by developing materials requested for daily business activities.
* Development and modification of advertising materials for marketing campaigns and promotions.
* Assist with ensuring a consistent look and feel across Bank websites, social media outlets, applications and intranets by developing and promoting a uniform branding strategy.
* Assist with the development, deployment and management of messaging displayed on ATMs and Marketing TVs. Interact with vendors and Departments/Branches to troubleshoot problems and ensure performance standards.
* Help out as needed by performing other related duties which may be required from time to time.

title: Hotel Front Desk Agent
description:
**Schulte Hospitality Group** is seeking a dynamic, service-oriented ***Hotel*** ***Front Desk Agent***to join our team! **SHG** is an organization whose success is rooted in its service culture. Our mission is to exude hospitality, be respectful and authentic, prioritize the needs of our internal and external stakeholders above our own, and continuously strive to make a positive impact in all we do. We are passionate hoteliers eager to add like-minded people to our rapidly growing team!





**What's in it for you?** When you join **SHG** you'll be part of a team committed to an inclusive, employee-focused workplace that is invested in your development. We want you to feel engaged, empowered, and excited to grow with us. After all, we believe our greatest and most valuable asset is our people! **SHG** provides a rewarding, fun and flexible work environment, exciting perks, an atmosphere designed to encourage and promote career growth within the company and a robust benefit package including, but not limited to:





Work Today, Get Paid today, with Daily Pay!  

Free Telemedicine and Virtual Mental Health care access for All Associates starting day one!  

Multiple Health Insurance and Life Insurance options  

401k Plan + Company Match  

Paid Time Off  

Holiday Pay  

Pet Insurance  

Employee Assistance Program  

Schulte Savings Marketplace Discounts on event tickets, electronics, gym memberships + more!





**Our Company:** **Schulte Hospitality Group** is a division of Schulte Companies, a leading third-party management company with deep, multi-generational experience in all facets of the hospitality industry. We are a diverse team of innovative hoteliers and restauranteurs operating more than 200 locations across 38 states and 3 countries. Our portfolio includes a wide array of reputable brands like Marriott, Hilton, IHG and Hyatt as well as many unique, independent, boutique and lifestyle properties and restaurants.





**JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Greets guests as they arrive, focus on personal recognition
* Reviews arrival lists daily and assists in preparing and assembling welcome amenities
* Escort VIPs to room and check them in prior to arrival
* Answer the telephone within three rings with a smile and answer questions accordingly or transfer as needed
* Responsible for issued bank. Count bank at beginning and end of shift. Ensure that all cash drops are done in accordance to with proper cash handling procedures and report all cash over/ shorts to management.
* Keep front desk area clean and organized.
* Assisting with lobby activation as needed.
* Utilize proper procedures when handling guest PPI data.
* Follow checklist when going through check in or check out with guest. Always retrieve necessary identification documents and form of payment upon arrival.
* Attends promptly to guest needs and inquiries
* Perform various other duties as assigned
* Perform various other duties as assigned to meet business objectives


**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**


* Minimum of one (1) year in Front Desk Operations
* In-depth knowledge of hotel Front Desk operations
* Minimum of High School education

  


**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES**


* Basic computer skills
* Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing
* Ability to exceed expectations of guests and team members
* Excellent time management skills

  



Work Today, Get Paid today, with **Daily Pay!**



The hiring process may consist of a phone interview, manager(s) interview, drug screen, background check, reference checks, and potential employment assessment. This job description is only intended to provide a general description of the benefits and compensation applicable to this position. Paid Time Off (PTO) is available for eligible associates in accordance with the Company's Paid Time Off policy. Specific compensation and benefit details will be discussed during the interview process.





***\\*Schulte Hospitality Group*** *is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*
  

Compensation: $17.00

title: Program Coordinator
company: Institute for Social and Economic Research and Policy at Columbia University
description:
**Program Coordinator**

* Job Type: Officer of Administration
* Regular/Temporary: Regular
* Hours Per Week: 35
* Salary Range: $62,400 to $68,000

**All applications must be submitted through Columbia University’s Career's website. Please use this link to apply:** https://opportunities.columbia.edu/jobs/program-coordinator-morningside-new-york-united-states-7480954b-ef17-413c-8088-083b298381fd

**Position Summary**

The Quantitative Methods in the Social Sciences (QMSS) MA program at Columbia University is one of the oldest interdisciplinary applied statistics MA programs of its kind. We count hundreds of data scientists, senior analysts, and academic researchers among our alumni.

Reporting to the QMSS Director, the Program Coordinator is primarily responsible for all financial and administrative support elements for the QMSS program. The incumbent will assist with processing all financial elements of the program, supporting the hiring process of student officers, coordinating operational elements of event planning, assisting with the recruitment and admissions process, as well as with answering questions for incoming and current students.

**Responsibilities**

**Academic & Student Affairs**

* Assists with the student recruitment and the admissions process for QMSS, including coordinating the reading of applications, processing decisions in the online system, and working with the admissions office on scheduling and communication.
* Maintains all student records, including schedules, credits, graduation intentions, financial aid, course-taking, and other student data.
* Serves as a resource for students navigating University systems: checks in with students having difficulties, monitors student progress, coordinates degree audits, clears students to graduate, processes leave of absence, withdrawals from the program, and change of grades, and keeps students updated with upcoming deadlines. Sends out weekly newsletters to students and alumni.
* Handles academic course arrangements, including scheduling courses, submitting courses for approval to GSAS, reserving classrooms for all courses, ensuring courses are posted on the directory of classes, assists faculty with CourseWorks setup, grade submission, class rosters, and compiles evaluation reports and distributes to faculty and staff.
* Serves as a liaison and advocate for students regarding other University offices (e.g., ISSO, Bursar, and Registrar).
* Acts as the first point of contact for QMSS in general, responding to student and program inquiries.

**Operations**

* The Program Coordinator is responsible for supporting the hiring and onboarding of students as Teaching Assistants and Departmental Research Assistants including coordinating the recruitment process for the QMSS DRA Match program and tracking the program’s budget.
* Responsible for handling program purchases, reconciling expenses monthly, and processing reimbursements.
* Works closely with ISERP’s administrative unit on academic and student appointments -- financial, operational, and logistical transactions.
* Works closely with work-study students to complete program tasks.

**Event Planning**

* The incumbent is responsible for all the operational elements of event planning, including scheduling of rooms, ordering food, and coordinating students -- for events like orientation, town halls, social events, career panels, and workshops. Required to work occasional evenings and weekends.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* A bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* 0-2 years of related experience are required.
* The successful candidate will have excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
* Resourcefulness, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks with competing priorities.
* Must be able to handle confidential information.
* Excellent judgment and discretion are required.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Master’s degree desirable but not required.
* Experience in an academic environment.
* Experience in student advising.

title: Media Planner Paid Search (SEM)
description:
**Who We Are**

Crossmedia is the global media independent. We’re committed to doing media and business the right way, guided by the principles of TRUST, REASON and the pursuit of HAPPINESS. Crossmedia US was founded in NY in 2000 and is one of the largest minority-owned full service media planning & buying agencies in the nation. Together with our network partners in Germany and the UK, we are 600+ Crossmedians worldwide with big ambitions to continue to grow with soul.

We focus on what media agencies should do: create innovative connections between brands and people regardless of channel or budget. And, we do it in an honest way. We are and always have been a values-based organization. We earn our clients TRUST by ensuring media transparency in our business model and objectivity in decision-making. We apply REASON & logic to everything and have one of the leading analytics groups in the industry committed to uncovering data insights to drive solutions. The pursuit of HAPPINESS matters to us. Big time. We are committed to each colleague‘s professional & personal wellbeing and growth. It’s why we have countless initiatives, clubs & cultural events dedicated to our people and why we‘ve been the top ranked media agency on Ad Age’s Best Places to Work for the past three years in a row.

In the US, we have offices in New York, Philadelphia and Los Angeles. Our client roster includes US Bank, White Castle, NASCAR, Invesco, Planet Fitness, Newell Brands, American Cancer, Illva Saronno, Edible (Arrangements), Teramana, Lightbox, and more.

**Who You Are**

This role is focused on paid search and sits within our Marketplace team, which covers biddable media - Paid Social, Paid Search and Programmatic.  This position is ideal for someone who is disciplined, yet comfortable in a casual and collaborative environment. Most importantly, you’re truly passionate about advertising and enjoy both teaching and learning about the wonderful world of paid search and digital media.

**Your ROLE**

Here is a snapshot of your day-to-day as a Paid Search Planner –

· Strategizes, optimizes & executes digital media campaigns with a focus in SEM.

· Utilizes Google AdWords, Bing ads and DoubleClick (DCM/Dart Search) platforms to run a variety of media tactics within those platforms such as SEM, GDN, Retargeting, RLSA, Video and Shopping.

· Leadership: including leading day to day client operations, management of assistants, and POVs. You know how to train and supervise assistants and interns ensuring best in class strategy and execution. You know how to communicate with clients verbally, in written form and have strong presentation skills.

· Cross channel integration: Implements an integrated strategy and execution, with a specific interest in learning paid social and programmatic digital (RTB, trading desks/DSP/DMP) strategies.

**REQUIREMENTS**

· 1.5 - 2 years of hands-on experience in the strategy, execution & optimization of digital media campaigns with a focus in SEM.

· Experience with AdWords, Bing ads and DoubleClick (DCM/Dart Search) platforms [highly preferred].

· Analytical skills, both the ability to interpret overall social performance and paid campaign performance (within and beyond KPIs of social platforms) .

· Entrepreneurial attitude: You’re excited at the idea of building the agency with new tools, ideas and opportunities.

· Additional experience with 3rd party digital ad tech such as adservers, site side analytics, DMPs, PMDs and/or multi-touch attribution is a plus.

**CROSSMEDIA BENEFITS**

Our principles of Trust, Reason and the Pursuit of Happiness are brought to life through benefits that recognize and support the diversity and physical, emotional and professional well-being of our people, including:

* Work from anywhere flexibility including hybrid/remote office options to empower you to work your way
* Open PTO policy and paid sabbaticals at significant milestone anniversaries
* Fully-funded healthcare options and agency-wide physical & mental health support
* 401(k) with company match, student loan relief program and financial counseling support
* Generous paid parental leave policy
* Life milestone recognition & support
* The Pursuit of Happiness Fund devoted to helping Crossmedians find their happy (be it travel, enrichment class, fitness membership or professional development)
* Cell phone/tech reimbursement
* Student Loan payment plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* And burgers – lots and lots of burgers

**COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION**

Diversity is in our DNA. As a minority-owned company, our commitment to an inclusive environment has long been embedded into agency practices and at every level. Almost one third of senior leadership identifies as a person of color and over half of our executive leadership are women. We have active mentoring & internship programs that create opportunities for underrepresented groups. Internal agency programming is anchored by XMEquity365, a permanent, year-round initiative fostering acknowledgement and support of marginalized communities within five pillars – Excellence, Voices, Education, Giving & Representation.

*Crossmedia is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and creating a diverse and inclusive company culture and that does not discriminate against candidates and employees because of their disability, sex, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law.* 

*All job requirements are subject to possible revision to reflect changes in the position requirements, business necessities and/or to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Essential and other job functions are subject to modification. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to which will be required in this position. Employees will be required to follow other job-related duties as requested by their supervisor/manager (within guidelines and compliance with Federal and State Laws).*

*Continued employment remains on an “at-will” basis.” Reasonable accommodations may be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions in compliance with the American with Disabilities Act of 1990.* 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,011.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) 6% Match
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid parental leave
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Unlimited paid time off
* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

* SEM /Paid Search: 1 year (Preferred)
* DoubleClick (DCM/Dart Search): 1 year (Preferred)
* Bing ads: 1 year (Preferred)
