title: Digital Client Experience & Platforms – Product Owner
description:
Digital Client Experience & Platforms – Product Owner

Job Number:

 3256837


POSTING DATE: Aug 5, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


COMPANY PROFILE

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  


JOB DESCRIPTION
We are seeking a talented and motivated digital product manager to join the Morgan Stanley Wealth Management Digital Client Experience & Platforms team. The Digital Client Experience & Platforms team defines and drives the online and mobile experiences for Morgan Stanley clients. As a digital product manager, you will set direction and contribute to the creation and on-going success of the latest digital solutions for our clients. You will support the current financials experiences for E\\*TRADE.com and Morgan Stanley Online and more importantly be a lead in the unification of Financials bringing together the digital experiences for self-directed, bank and advised clients.  



You will be a vital part of a dynamic team responsible for delivering the digital client-facing experience for all digital platforms, including Morgan Stanley Online/Mobile, Shareworks and E\\*TRADE. As a smart, passionate, detail-oriented team player who loves interacting with a diverse set of people solving tough problems and challenging the status quo, this is an amazing opportunity to forge a new digital direction for a highly respected company that is deeply committed to reinventing itself. Strong performing individuals will be supported in further professional development.  



RESPONSIBILITIES  

* Product owner for a digital agile squad responsible for definition and delivery of core product features and experiences to meet target audience needs consistent with product strategy and vision
* Identify and elaborate on critical user journeys, use cases, workflows, and business processes that align with the product vision/goals and address critical user and control needs

* Build and maintain prioritized product backlog – identify, groom, and validate epics and user stories for agile sprints; Lead backlog refinement and sprint planning ceremonies to communicate requirements and drive consensus with squad and program stakeholders


* Work closely with the technology team to assure effective communication of requirements and rapid delivery of key product releases
* Facilitate product development lifecycle from defining product vision/scope to launching MVP to ongoing management of product to meet KPIs; Drive definition and prioritization of product roadmap, release planning, and development and communication of business requirements
* Collaborate with key stakeholders from business, technology, UX, risk, cyber & fraud, communications, legal & compliance to elicit requirements


* Prepare presentations, user demos, and status updates
* Gather, organize, and assimilate internal and external feedback to identify and prioritize product gaps, enhancements, and new features
* Collaborate with UI/UX team to develop information/interaction architecture, user flows, wireframes, and visual design comps
* Team up with program management office to effectively organize and plan product releases
* Define and track KPIs and product/program adoption and usage metrics – evangelize adoption
  


QUALIFICATIONS

* 5-7 years of experience as software or digital product manager, business analyst or equivalent with experience working within an agile/scrum development process

* Proficient at defining, analyzing, documenting, and communicating product and software requirements in an agile software development setting


* Keen intellect – ability to gather, analyze and synthesize a significant amount of information, and turn it into clear and actionable product requirements


* Naturally curious, analytical and data-driven – demonstrated track record of utilizing data to measure performance, identify opportunities, and make successful decisions
* Experience collaborating with UI/UX designers and developers to deliver client-friendly products and user experiences
* Understanding and knowledge of web and mobile technologies
* Written and verbal communication skills able to effectively interact and influence a diverse set of business and technical stakeholders
* Efficient at managing multiple projects and initiatives concurrently under deadline constraints


* Thought-leader – strong familiarity with industry trends and best practices, and a perspective on how to advance the current state-of-play


* Bachelor’s degree is required


* Knowledge or exposure to wealth management and online brokerage/banking preferred


* Series 7 and Series 24 license preferred but not required
* Demonstrated track record of delivering new innovative fintech, digital products, solutions, or applications preferred

  



Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $100,000 and $180,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.  



Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.

title: Wireless Sales Representative - AT&T - Bilingual (Spanish)
description:
With almost 2,000 AT&T stores coast-to coast, Prime Communications is AT&T's largest authorized wireless retailer in the United States, and we want you to join us as a Retail Sales Consultant!



A Retail Sales Consultant (RSC) is a **brand** ambassador to our extraordinarily large base of customers nationwide. **Our RSC associates** serve the customer by demonstrating AT&T's vast array of products, services and entertainment options, **by** offering them **personalized and valuable wireless, entertainment, and connectivity** solutions to **fit their ever-evolving lifestyle** in a **fast-paced retail sales** industry.



Because we strive for the best, we offer amongst the best. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn a minimum base of ($25,000 + commission). Consultants could earn an average of $45,000 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals in the first year. Commission is based on meeting outlined sales goals for a given market.



You'll also be eligible for some or all of our amazing Benefits Packages, such as:


* We offer New Hire Ramp Up Bonus payments for the first three months
* Training and Opportunity to grow
* Supportive team environment
* Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k and more


Not to mention some pretty cool perks such as:


* Latest devices and discounts on wireless service plans
* Using our technology, gain first-hand expertise to share with our customers
* Discounts on accessories and additional AT&T products and services, meaning you will always have access to the latest gadgets around


Dedication is always a good predictor of success at Prime Communications. Most Store Managers, were once RSCs, most District Managers were once Store Managers, etc. Join the community and forge your own sales path today!


* Provide extraordinary customer service by being compassionate towards and understanding their needs
* Build value by offering tailored and thoughtful solutions to fit each person, family or business
* Represent our Company and the AT&T brand with the utmost professionalism and courtesy
* Assist our leaders with store operations and duties
* Cooperate with your fellow RSCs to achieve a team approach to sales and customer service
* Achieve sales benchmarks and milestones (which can lead to that much needed extra bonus payment)
* Excel in selling AT&T's products/services, including entertainment, as we are a full-service lifestyle solution
* Work with wireless leaders to stand out, serve and succeed within the local community

Requirements:
**Requirements**


* Clear communication skills

Attitude and technical aptitude * - having an entrepreneurial spirit speaks volumes  

Commitment to exemplary customer service, honesty and integrity
* Background in retail sales is helpful, but not required
* At least 18 years old and legally able to work in the United States without restrictions.
* Ability to work a minimum of 32 hours per week including evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Strong Social Media presence preferred
* Must have reliable transportation to location, off-site trainings, and meetings.
* Must live within 30 minutes of home store location with flexibility to work at multiple locations within a district as needed.
* Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax.
* Adhere to Team Color policy while maintaining neat and professional appearance.


**Working Conditions**


* Ability to lift up to 10 pounds.
* Ability to bend, squat and stretch for purposes of inventory and stocking.
* Requirement to stand for long periods of time in order to provide the best customer service (with or without a reasonable accommodation).
* Ability to work in fast pace environment.
* Ability to follow instructions to completion.
* Ability to work under pressure, multi-task and handle customer complaints or requests.
* Ability to adapt to fluctuating noise levels and varied sounds from multiple media sources/devices.
* Problem solves under pressure.  

	+ Job Type: Full-time
	+ Pay: $40,000.00-$50,000.00
	+ Shift: 8 hour shift
	+ Weekly day range: Weekend availability

title: Store Associate
description:
**Come work for us!**

We are looking for dedicated employees to join our team to help our customers have the best experience possible every time they enter a JD Finish Line store.

***Our employees are key to our success.***

**Position Title:** JD - Associate

**Summary:** Performs sales and customer service tasks.

**Sample Responsibilities:**

* Performs sales and customer service responsibilities.
* Performs cashiering, stock room upkeep and store upkeep as needed.
* Maintains company standards regarding personal sales metrics.

**This is a summary of some of the key duties, responsibilities, and physical demands expected of this position. It is not intended to be a complete job description.**

**Physical Demands:**

* Requires standing approximately 5 – 8 hours per day usually 3 – 5 days per week.
* During peak sale periods (e.g. Holiday, Back-to-School), will work for long periods throughout a 1 – 12 hour day.
* Requires stooping and kneeling to place merchandise on customer’s feet as well as reaching and pulling to obtain or stock merchandise on storage racks.
* May be required to climb ladder or ascend/descend stairs in order to stock and/or acquire merchandise for sale.
* Required to lift items weighing 5 – 25 lbs regularly. In certain circumstances, weights may be higher.

**Physical Demands -** The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The company reserves the right to modify this job description with or without notice. Employees may be asked to perform additional duties outside of normal job scope on a temporary basis per company policy. ​

**EEOC Statement:**

The Finish Line, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to complying with all federal, state, and local EEO laws. The Finish Line, Inc. prohibits discrimination against employees and applicants for employment based on the individual's race or color, religion or creed, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, sex, pregnancy status, age, military status, disability, or any other protected characteristic or class protected by law. The Finish Line, Inc. provides reasonable accommodation for disabilities in accordance with applicable laws.

**Need accessibility assistance to apply?**  
Applicants who require accessibility assistance to submit an employment application can either call Finish Line at (317) 613-6890 or email us at talentacquisition@finishline.com. A member of our Talent Acquisition team will respond as soon as reasonably possible. (This email address and phone number is only for individuals seeking accommodation when applying for a job.)

title: Retail Associate/Cashier/Customer Service
description:
At Nuts Factory we are truly passionate about bringing a unique market-style shopping experience. After opening our flagship to serve the Upper East Side, Manhattan Community we felt the need to expand beyond New York City. We strive to preserve the excellence of our assorted Beans, Chocolates, Candies, Dried Fruits, Granolas, Nuts, and Spices. Promoting quality assortments is what keeps us going!

***Now Hiring: Retail Associates***

We are in search of coachable, energetic, and trustworthy individuals to work at our location. This is a great opportunity if you’re customer service driven and enthusiastic about product knowledge!

***Retail Associates***

Your job is more than just organizing and stocking. Your job is to create a welcoming environment for new and returning guests. Your job is to form relationships and memorable experiences with guests. You will prioritize the guest experience whether you’re cleaning, providing product knowledge, organizing, or stocking because you are a valuable part of the overall guest experience. Your day-to-day consists of

* Warmly greeting guests by sustaining eye contact and offering your help as needed.
* Performing transactional duties by following company protocol.
* Replenishing the sales floor as inventory levels decrease.
* Maintaining a sanitized and disinfected storefront.

***Job Requirements*** 

* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* Experience In Customer Service Oriented Setting
* Ability to Work at an Alternating Pace
* Professional Approach
* High Energy and Gracious Attitude

***Performance Requirements***

* Arrive to Work on Time and In Dressed as Required
* Ensure All Products on the Salesfloor are Fresh and Presentable
* Ensure Product Quality by Rotating and Removing Out-of-Date Products
* Be an Expert in Our Products and Explain them to Customers
* Package, Weigh, and Price our Goods
* Follow our Transactional Protocol
* Maintain Open Communication Regarding Store-Front Concerns.

***We Look Forward to Hearing from You!***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Morning shift

Work Location: In person

title: Assistant Teacher
description:
$200 Sign on Bonus for Qualified Candidates!  

  

Assistant Teachers at The Learning Experience are ambassadors of happiness, creating opportunities every day that reflect our mission to make a difference in the lives of children, their families, and communities.  

  

The ideal candidate for this role will possess a compassionate attitude and a growth mindset to develop young minds and inspire a love of learning  

  

**Role Responsibilities:**  

* Partner with and learn from the teachers in your classroom to create a welcoming, engaging classroom space for children to learn, play and grow
* Use a growth mindset to develop young minds and inspire a love of learning
* Implement our proprietary L.E.A.P. Curriculum®, working with Infants, Toddlers, and/or Preschool children in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child.
* Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
* Communicate regularly with parents, sharing their children’s latest adventures and achievements through a variety of avenues, including mobile apps and personal discussions.
* Support your center’s success, partnering with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment and engagement.
* Build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happen seamlessly.

  

**Qualifications:**  

* High School Diploma/ GED required
* ECE coursework preferred
* Must meet state specific guidelines for the role

  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to The Learning Experience Corporate.*
company_description: Happy Happens Here! From preschool through kindergarten, we make early education and daycare joyful, engaging and fun so children are happy to learn, play and grow.

title: Preschool Soccer Leader
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Bonus based on performance
* Flexible schedule
* Free uniforms
* Training & development

  

**Looking for a flexible job? Join Soccer Shots and be the best part of a child's week!**  

  

Soccer Shots is an engaging children's soccer program with an emphasis on character development. Our caring team positively impacts children's lives on and off the field through best-in-class coaching, curriculum and communication.  

  

No soccer experience needed! Soccer Shots will provide ALL training!  

  

**WHAT YOU GET:**  

  

* $18 - $20 per 30-45 minute session
* Flexible scheduling catered to your location and availability
* Great company culture
* Thorough Training
* Uniform and equipment necessary to run classes

**WHAT YOU NEED:**  

  

* Passion to positively impact children (ages 2-8)
* Reliable transportation and a valid Drivers License or State ID
* High School Diploma
* Eligible to work in the U.S.

**A DAY IN THE LIFE:**  

  

* Safely manage a class of up to 12 children at a PreK school, park, or indoor field in Monmouth County, NJ
* Implement our curriculum which focuses on skill and character development
* Arrive on-time to your locations and provide a positive customer experience to faculty and families
* Maintain equipment and manage your class rosters

**OUR CORE VALUES:**  

  

* We care
* We own it
* We pursue excellence
* We are stronger together
* We are candid
* We grow


  

If you have a passion for positively impacting children, we’d love to talk to you.  

  

Soccer Shots is an international franchise brand with 200 territories in the U.S. and Canada. This position is for your local franchise. Visit soccershots.com to learn more.  

  

If this isn't for you but you know of someone who might be interested in joining our team, feel free to pass our info along - we love referrals!

title: Barista/Cashier
description:
Do you have a passion for crafting delicious beverages and providing exceptional customer service? Join our team as a Barista! We're looking for responsible individuals who are friendly, efficient multitaskers, and thrive in a team-oriented environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and serve a variety of high-quality beverages, including coffee and tea, with precision and care.
* Greet customers warmly, take orders accurately, and provide friendly, personalized service to enhance the customer experience.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the bakery, adhering to health and safety standards.
* Handle cash transactions and operate the point-of-sale system with accuracy.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth operations and efficient service during peak hours.

**Requirements:**

* Previous experience as a barista or in customer service is preferred but not required.
* Friendly and outgoing personality with a genuine desire to engage with customers and create positive experiences.
* Strong multitasking abilities to handle a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Productive work ethic with attention to detail
* A team player who communicates effectively and contributes to a positive work atmosphere.

**Additional Details:**

* Weekend availability is required.
* Training will be provided for candidates who demonstrate enthusiasm and a willingness to learn.

If you're passionate about coffee, pastries and enjoy interacting with people, we'd love to have you join our team! To apply, please submit your resume along with a brief cover letter highlighting why you're a great fit for the role.

title: Resident Advisor -Weekend Overnight
description:
We’re building something new in New York City: gender-affirming recovery housing that promotes skills-based learning and community support for young adults navigating mental health concerns.

Housed in a residence that pairs self-contained apartments with vibrant community spaces all under one roof, dWELL’s mission is to empower our residents with the support and tools they need for launching sustainable, independent lives.

Dwell Recovery has an ongoing need for part-time Resident Assistants (RA)'s to work the Friday & Sunday overnight shift.

Daily RA Duties (depending on your shift) are as follows:

* Conducts room checks and oversees chore responsibilities
* Manages alcohol and drug testing onsite
* Manages medication monitoring process with residents
* Transports residents to all necessary appointments and offsite engagements
* Accompanies residents to 12 Step / support meetings in the community
* Lead/co-lead on site groups and community building activities.
* Complete shift reports, UA reports, medication reports, and chore reports.
* Regular house “walk throughs” to ensure the house is tidy and tour ready.
* Manages all other responsibilities as directed by PD or APD
* Other duties as instructed by management

Overnight RA

* Every two hour room checks and hallway walk through
* Lock electronics when indicated.
* Wake-up support for all residents

Please be sure to attach your resume which includes all of your contact details, and a brief cover letter indicating your availability.

*Dwell Recovery is an equal opportunity employer. We consider applicants for all positions on the basis of merit, qualifications and business needs, and without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, age, disability, alienage or citizenship status, ancestry, marital status, partnership status, creed, sexual and reproductive health decisions, genetic predisposition or carrier status, sexual orientation, uniformed service or veteran status, familial status, status as a victim of domestic violence or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.*

* Overnight shift
* Weekends as needed

* Caregiving: 1 year (Preferred)

title: Patient Care Associate - Contract
description:
**Education :** Work requires a high school level of knowledge (graduate or equivalent) in order to prepare reports, keep records and deal effectively with people. AHA HeartSaver or BLS Required.

**Hours Per Week : 40.00**

**Hours Per Days : 8.00**

**Days Per Week : 5.00**

**Duties ;**

Job Summary As an integral part of the clinical care team, the Patient Care Associate is responsible for patient care and support activities promoting patient focused care within the Specialty Service. The Patient Care Associate supports the registered nurse in patient care activities, such as: assisting patient with activities of daily living, collecting specimens and performing procedures; maintaining a safe, clean environment; and other duties as needed. Essential Duties and Responsibilities • Performs and records patient's vital signs, such as blood pressure, pulse, temperature and respirations. Documents intake and output and other data as assigned. • Obtains patients' rating on pain scales as a fifth vital sign in all areas except Pediatrics. • Performs clinical procedures, such as specimen collection, venipuncture, EKG, application of compression devices, post-mortem care, and maintenance of skin integrity. Sets up for selected procedures and assists RN's accordingly. • Assists patient with activities of daily living, such as feeding, bathing, mouth care, back rubs and/or toileting. Orients patients to clinical environment. Assists patient with ambulation and all levels of mobilization. • Assists with dietary functions, including delivering and collecting patient trays at bedside, passing menus to patients and assisting them with menu completion, mixing nutritional supplements, reporting variation in eating patterns to RN/Dietitian, and maintaining accurate and timely systems for transmission of patient dietary orders and changes. • Maintains a safe, clean and functional environment, including ensuring for the comfortable movement of the patient. Assists the patient in room maintenance, such as bed-stripping and trash removed, when necessary. • Performs one-to-one observation or close observation status of patients, e.g., safety, elopement risk, or suicide prevention. • Maintains """"isolation status"""" for patients under direction of an RN and according to set procedures. • Performs scheduled purposeful rounding on patients with emphasis on caring for toileting needs, comfort, positioning and pain awareness. Documents on rounding log . Notifies RN is rounding has not been completed as scheduled or if issues are identified. • Utilizes Vocera system according to sign in/sign out protocol where activated. • Performs other duties as assigned, including generating reports. • Is open and responsive to the diverse backgrounds and experience of other people and promotes an environment that is sensitive to cultural diversity. • Respects and values each patient's unique, individual needs, beliefs, and diversity and incorporates these into delivery of care. Staff Shared Duties and Responsibilities Across Clinical Specialties • Greets visitors and answers telephones promptly and courteously. Escorts visitors to appropriate area, when necessary. Delivers flowers to patients. • Operates the pneumatic tube system when required. title: Temporary Academic Events Associate
description:
Job Description:
BerkleeNYC seeks a creative professional to serve as an Academic Events Associate at BerkleeNYC.  

  

Workplace Description:  

  

Berklee’s NYC campus is a hybrid facility consisting of graduate degree programs, summer programs, and the operation of Power Station, the largest professional recording studio in NYC servicing clients in the music, film, theater, and television industries.  

  

Berklee NYC’s Master of Arts in creative media and technology is designed to teach the tools and strategies needed to thrive in artistic fields that continually evolve and change at a rapid pace. The core curriculum of the graduate program provides foundational knowledge that addresses both the business and creative sides of the performing arts. The three specializations are for the graduate program include: Live Music Production and Design, Songwriting and Production, and Writing and Production for Musical Theater.  

  

Power Station at Berklee NYC houses facilities for both the commercial studios and academic programs. Containing 5 recording studios as well as a black box theater and spaces such as a video control room, classrooms, and labs, Berklee NYC offers services for recording, education, events, and performances. The facility offers round-the-clock service to both professional clients as well as full-time students operating as a truly hybrid commercial and educational facility.  

  

Job Description:  

  

Reporting to the Director of Academic Operations and Student Success, the Academic Events Associate is responsible for the planning, coordination, and execution of a wide range of academic events at BNYC. Collaborating with program directors, faculty, staff, and students at BNYC, you will assist in tasks ranging from project management, stage management, student communications, and budget management.  

  

You are a team player with strong communication skills, who thrives in dynamic environments and excels at collaborating with colleagues to achieve common goals.  

  

You will find success in this role if you possess an acute attention to detail, demonstrate an advanced understanding of audio and video equipment, and project management, and have a basic understanding of educational and pedagogical practices.  

  

You are willing to work flexible hours to adapt and accommodate a dynamic schedule of academic activities throughout the year. You can anticipate on average 25-30 hours a week during the academic year (September through mid-December; mid-January through the End of June) and expect a minimum of 10 hrs/ week when school is in session.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:* Overseeing and running the event request system for all non-classroom-related academic activities
* Organize, produce and/or execute:
	+ Monthly open mic events, including artist selection, communication, and coordination of event staff and equipment.
	+ Career Center Visiting Artist Series in coordination with Assistant Director of Student Success and the Career Center
	+ Faculty Workshops in coordination with Program Directors
	+ International Student Services events in coordination with the Assistant Director of student success and the career center
	+ Student affairs weekly and monthly wellness events
	+ Admissions Open houses in coordination with the Enrollment and Admissions Associate
* Coordinating with student employees and the Academic operations team to ensure that events are appropriately staffed
* Stage management:
	+ Create and Maintain comprehensive production documents including input lists, call sheets, rehearsal schedules and run of show notes as required/appropriate
* Manage event budgets
* Setup and breakdown of spaces for educational activities and events
	+ Setting up instruments, backline, microphones, and other audio equipment
	+ Setting up lighting fixtures and operating lighting consoles
	+ Moving and setting up video equipment and lighting
* Supporting students in their design and operation of events in a professional venue

  

Experience and Competencies:* Willingness and ability to work both independently and as part of a team
* A degree in production, stage management, creative or performing arts, creative media, or related field or commensurate experience
* Understanding of DAWs, audio interfaces, audio connectivity, and MIDI
* Willingness and flexibility to work nights and weekends
* Great communication skills
* Attention to detail in all areas of work
* Critical thinking, Problem-solving, and decision-making skills while using good judgment and maintaining professionalism
* A learning and growth mindset to advance in competency with experience at Berklee NYC
* Demonstrated commitment to diversity, fairness, and equal opportunity
* Culturally sensitive to a wide variety of backgrounds and communication styles
* Flexibility to adapt to changing surroundings and situations
* Willingness and ability to navigate within a complex academic setting and build and cultivate relationships


Preferred skills:* Live performance lighting, video and sound experience are greatly preferred
* Knowledge of basic video systems, lighting, or live sound is a huge plus


Submissions:  

  

Electronic applications only. Please submit the following application materials in PDF or Word format. All materials can be uploaded to the Resume/Cover Letter application section.
Please send:* A letter of application
* A current resume or CV
* Three professional references & their contact information.
* Links to websites or online resources with representative samples of your work
* You may be asked to submit additional materials after your application has been reviewed by the search committee.

  

WORK ENVIRONMENT:  

SPECIAL WORKING CONDITIONS, PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS, ETC. (Responsible for on-call, 24 HR. coverage, etc.)  

May be required to move audio equipment (up to 60 lbs), Pianos, and other instruments as required to execute a successful class, event, or recording session.
Flexible availability is required to support student services sometimes up to 7 days/week during the academic year.
External and internal applicants, as well as position incumbents who become disabled as defined under the Americans With Disabilities Act, must be able to perform the essential job functions (as listed) either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation to be determined by management on a case-by-case basis.  

  

Pay Range: $25 - $28/hour
This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” employment relationship.  

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at Berklee:
We support an inclusive workplace where everyone excels based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance. Berklee affirms that inequality is detrimental to our faculty, staff, students, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to make lasting change through our actions. Berklee is committed to providing fair and equitable consideration of all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, ancestry, age, national origin, place of birth, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, genetic information, or status as a member of the armed forces or veteran of the armed forces, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.
As part of this commitment, Berklee will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact the Human Resources Team at hroperations@Berklee.edu or call 617-747-2375.*Berklee is committed to increasing the diversity of our institution, community, and the curriculum. Candidates who can contribute to that goal are encouraged to apply and to identify their strengths in this area.*
\\*Currently enrolled Berklee students are not permitted to apply for staff or faculty positions.\\*

title: Histotechnologist
description:
**Position: Histotechnologist**

**Location: Mount Kisco, NY**

**Department: Pathology**

**Schedule: Monday to Friday (8.5 hour day, start time flexible)**

**Hourly Rate: $50 to $60** 

**Job Responsibilities:** (This list may not contain all the duties assigned and can change)

· Performs laboratory tests and procedures, which require independent judgment and responsibility with minimal supervision by the lead technologist and laboratory supervisor.

· Documents daily QC and corrective action as needed.

· Performs calibrations, linearity testing, and proficiency testing as required.

· Enters and verifies laboratory results in the LIS.

· Assists with training and orientation of departmental personnel.

· Resolves problems with technical testing involving methodology, techniques and instrumentation utilization.

· Reviews, and evaluates test results and reports for accuracy, precision, readability and consistency.

· Collects data, prepares reports, and compiles statistics directed.

· Actively supports and assists in implementation and monitoring of quality control and quality assurance policies

· Perform cytology specimen preparatory procedures.

· Operation cytology processing equipment for preparation of gynecologic and non-gynecologic cytology specimens

· Maintenance of instrumentation and temperature logs

· Specimen accessioning as needed

· Data collection for reports and statistical compilation

· Checks supply inventory.

· Attends required meetings and participates in processional development activities.

· Maintains patient confidentiality.

· Performs related work as required.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:** Knowledge of clinical laboratory procedures, standards, and tests in order to accurately complete testing. Knowledge of laboratory equipment and testing in order to monitor quality control and troubleshoot. Knowledge of medical terminology to interact with medical staff regarding laboratory procedures and results. Knowledge of safety requirements to provide instruction and to recognize hazardous conditions. Skills in performing a full range of laboratory tests. Skills in anticipating and reacting calmly to emergency situations. Skill in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with patients, laboratory staff, and medical staff. Skill in identifying and resolving problems. Skill in using the LIS. Performs all the tasks necessary in the operation of the laboratory. Ability to work during operation hours.

**Qualifications / Education:**

· BS Degree in Medical Technology, Biology, or related sciences, as approved by the accrediting agencies.

· One year experience as a laboratory technologist.

· As required by governmental agencies. ASCP or NCA preferred.

· NYS license required.

title: French Teacher for Kids (in-person, New York City)
description:
As a French Teacher, you will help to create a well-structured, inclusive, and fun language learning environment for our young learners in grades Pre-K to 5th. You will use your experience, creativity, and passion for languages to create a place that is warm, positive, and organized, yet challenging and able to hold students accountable for their growth. Your teaching will be consistent with our mission, vision, and methodology. **Must be available to start the first week of September, Wednesdays-Fridays, 3-5 pm.** 

Job Responsibilities:

* Teach 3-6 hours of classes weekly. Must be available to start the first week of September, Wednesdays-Fridays, 3-5 pm.
* Work closely with our Founder and other teachers to continuously improve relevant curricula
* Use assessment data, student work, and other information to inform plans for student and class objectives
* Use positive reinforcement and social learning strategies as your way of teaching
* Prioritize each student's academic and social environment
* Understand and work in accordance with our mission and vision

About You:

* Bachelor's degree required
* Native-like level of proficiency in French
* A deep understanding of French and francophone cultures
* A deep belief in our mission and vision with a strong enthusiasm, passion, and energy
* A deep belief in community building and bonding to achieve results
* Authorized to work in the U.S.
* Preference will be given to teachers who have undergone fingerprinting for the DOE
* The critical features of this role are described above but are not all encompassing

About Us:

Diáfano is the language learning hub of the future, with human-centered philosophy at its very core. The Diáfano Method fuses tried and true methods of language learning with our own modern spin. Designed by a linguist and administered by a global community of top-tier native educators, our method hacks into the psychology of language learning to ensure maximum retention and true mastery.

Our Goal:

We empower people to immerse themselves in new cultures and create meaningful connections through language learning. We believe that language learning leads to cross-cultural understanding, so we aim to make it more accessible and more impactful than ever. Our goal is to help students achieve language mastery through methods focused on social learning. We rely on data to inform progress and our decision-making process, all while engaging in culturally-responsive pedagogy. As a teacher, your job is as much to teach about the language as it is to teach its cultural context and help to continue to build a culturally competent and understanding society.

Our Core Values:

* Mastery: We strive for mastery in everything that we do.
* Sincerity: Integrity means a lot to us. It is at the core of who we are.
* Innovation: We create our own rules to give you an experience and results you won’t find anywhere else.
* Inclusivity: We are driven to create classes that are culturally-relevant and driven. We believe in inclusivity from the teachers we hire to the courses we teach.
* Connection: We care about people, first and foremost. We always create a nurturing environment that supports bonding, connection, and growth.

We regret not being able to respond to all inquiries. No phone calls please.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $35.00 - $50.00 per hour

* Have you undergone fingerprinting for the DOE?

title: Cabin Service Agent
description:
Job Description:
As a Cabin Services Agent, you will play a crucial role in ensuring that the aircraft cabin is prepared for flights efficiently and safely, paying meticulous attention to every detail. Your responsibilities will include maintaining the cleanliness and readiness of the cabin, restocking supplies, and performing essential security checks.
Alliance Ground International is a cargo and aviation services company operating in over 50 cities across North America, with a 45-year legacy in aviation. Our strong reputation in cargo, ground services, and hospitality forms the bedrock of our success. As we continue to expand, we seek the industry's finest talents, where the sky is the limit.
Job Responsibilities:* Conduct thorough security searches on assigned aircraft.
* Remove trash and debris from seats, seat pockets, and ensure seat belts are properly arranged.
* Replenish in-flight magazines, safety cards, and personal sickness bags.
* Clean and sanitize aircraft galleys and lavatories, restocking supplies as needed.
* Empty lavatory tanks and refill as required.


Qualifications:* Minimum age of 18 and possession of a high school diploma, GED, or equivalent work experience.
* Successful completion of a drug screening and the ability to obtain airport security clearance, which includes a comprehensive 10-year employment, criminal record, and residence background check.


Physical Requirements:* Ability to lift up to 30 pounds (14 kg) on a regular basis.
* Frequent standing, lifting, bending, pushing, and pulling, often for extended periods.
* Comfort working in environments with jet and machinery noise.


Schedule:
Alliance Ground International operates twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week. AGI requires its employees to be able to work flexible schedules which may be adjusted to meet operational demands such as flight delays or cancellations. Applicants must be able to work on weekends, (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) and holidays. Strict adherence to company attendance policies is expected and enforced.
Benefits:
We provide competitive wages, comprehensive training and career advancement opportunities, as well as a full benefit plan.
Alliance Ground International is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. AGI is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or veteran status.
company_description: Alliance Ground International provides airline cargo handling services to 10 stations and 32 airlines in four cities: Chicago, New York, Atlanta, and Miami.

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
The **Registered Nurse** is accountable for evaluating each consumer's needs for nursing care on an ongoing basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities as defined by the ADA to perform the essential functions of the job. The functions below outline the general responsibilities associated with this position. Each of these functions is considered critical to effective department operations and our Mission. It is expected that all staff in this position will have satisfactory attendance and will perform these functions as assigned in a competent, cooperative, and timely manner. The Job Description will be reviewed periodically for accuracy and/or adjusted according to business necessity.

**The salary for the Registered Nurse is $48/per hour based on relevant experience.**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Serve as a leader in the delivery integrated nursing services to the clinic clients in accordance to health indicators.
* Provide integrated peer care services to the client population at the clinic as indicated by the OMH, CCBHC expansion scope of practice.
* Provide clients with services in the filed as required.
* Participate in grant related workshops and trainings.
* Use the grant portals; SPARS to enter any grant required data in terms of service provision, clinical indicators.
* Provide health assessments and medication management services for children, adolescents, and adults diagnosed with severe and persistent mental illness.
* Complete pharmacy reviews.
* Will work closely with the clinical staff on following up on prescribed medication, care coordination with pharmacy.
* Will record patient's vital signs and obtain patient history by integrating the health screening, PSYCKES clinical record as part of the triage process and assisting patients with completion.
* Perform health assessments and monitor all high indicators.
* Provide crisis intervention, including emergency hospital admission support.
* Coordinate medical/medication services with external providers including clinics, doctors, pharmacies, health homes.
* Will enhance patient's health and self- management skills as developing wellness goals in the use of EBPs on (WSM, Tobacco Cessation, nutrition, exercise and recovery and wellness) and maintain record of these activities.
* Administer psychotropic medication treatment, including administration of intravenous medications.
* Work as a member of a multidisciplinary treatment team and practice client centered and holistic care.
* Maintain compliant and timely documentation of services, case trackers and related clinical contacts in accordance with OMH regulations and organizational expectations.
* Perform clinical, compliance, and administrative duties as instructed.
* Participate in QA, UR, and IRC meetings.
* Carry out all relevant policies and procedures of the agency issued by management in accordance with funding agency guidelines. This does not limit the assignments of duties or exclude the performance of other duties, not mentioned as assigned by the supervisor.

**EDUCATION AND REQUIREMENTS:**

* **Previous relevant experience in a Mental or Behavioral Health environment required**
* **NYS Registered Nurse License required**
* Ability to use business acumen to exercise good judgment and decision-making
* Ability to deal with sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion
* Must be able to multi-task with strong organizational skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills and able to communicate both verbally and in written form
* Commitment to cultural diversity and sensitivity
* Ability to maintain a professional demeanor under pressure, and operate with a keen sense of urgency and commitment to quality
* ***Bi-lingual (Spanish/English) preferred***
* Excellent computer skills including, Microsoft Windows, Excel, PowerPoint, and electronic communications tools: internet and email and Excellent time management skills

**About Us:** Acacia Network, the leading Latino integration care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, and great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing, and community-building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we've been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland, and Puerto Rico.

**\\*Acacia Network is an equal opportunity employer\\***

title: Administrative Coordinator
Retail Sales Associate- OASES BAZAAR
description:
Join our team at OASES Bazaar!!

OASES is a wellness collective in the heart of NYC, dedicated to balancing community, nourishment, and well-being. We offer fresh, seasonal ingredients rooted in Ayurvedic practices across our café, bar, restaurant, and bazaar.

Our Bazaar is a vibrant retail space featuring organic pantry items, home goods, clean beauty products, and wellness items crafted by local artisans from around the world.

We create an immersive in-store retail experience, building lasting relationships and solving our customers' lifestyle needs. Our team is passionate about delivering quality products through an elevated customer experience. Join us on the OASES journey as we create what’s next.

About the Role of Sales Associate: you’ll be responsible for creating an authentic experience for every guest through personalized customer service and product education. You will become an expert in our products and build lasting relationships with customers, contributing to a best-in-class experience.

title: Sales Business Development
description:
**Throtle Business Development Position (Sales)**



Do you have the energy and motivation to hustle, solve problems, manage expectations and delight clients? Do you take pride in your attention to details and ability to build relationships with customers? Are you ready to join a team that encourages you to think outside the box and inspires you as an individual as well as a leader within new and emerging data technology? Throtle works on the belief that their best employees should be given opportunities to grow and thrive in an energetic and technology-driven culture. We hire and develop great people, which means that each and every one of our employees is not only talented, but they also genuinely care about the success of our customers and stand behind our company.  

Please consider joining our *Business Development* team as we offer as we offer an exciting opportunity to help drive revenue and shape the future of a high-growth technology company with identity resolution and data onboarding solutions.


**Location: Red Bank, NJ (New York city area)**


**What You’ll Do:**


* Drive sales from enterprise and mid-tier brands across our suite of Throtle solutions: identity resolution, audience intelligence, customer data onboarding, and closed loop measurement
* Identify, develop and close new opportunities and strategic relationships with consumer brands and/or their respective agencies
* Use consultative and solution selling skills to understand prospective client challenges and make clear recommendations of how Throtle solutions address their business needs
* Working in collaboration with our Customer Success team help further development and grow existing accounts
* Ensure that we exceed customer expectations and lock-in renewals
* Keep Salesforce up-to-date, track key metrics and communicate deal progress effectively internally
* Represent the voice of the customer to inform our sales process, marketing materials, and product roadmap


**What We’re Looking For:**


* 5 years of successful, quota-carrying Sales/Business Development experience in data, digital/programmatic media or other MarTech SaaS sales
* Experience with financial services/insurance, retail, travel/hospitality, automotive and other verticals with large digital ad budgets
* Firm understanding of data onboarding, identity resolution, and the AdTech ecosystem, including strong knowledge of DSPs/DMPs and how they operate
* Great communication skills – verbal and written, both externally with clients and internally with teammates
* Track record of achieving sales quotas
* Strategic relationship-building capabilities
* Truly committed to going above and beyond for clients with a “lead by example” approach
* Self-starter, independent and self-sufficient requiring little oversight to deliver against goals. Proactive in seeking help and expertise when needed.
* Empathetic, positive attitude with a desire and assertiveness to help our customers reach their goals and objectives
* Results-driven mentality, with a bias for speed and action
* Thrives in a growing company and dynamic environment, where we’re moving fast, scaling up and building new capabilities while delivering quality solutions for customers

title: Wine Sales Associate - Eataly Flatiron
description:
**Company Description**  

Eataly is the world’s largest artisanal Italian food and beverage marketplace! Eataly is not a chain; each Eataly is different, with its own character and own theme – but all with the same aim... for our guests to:

* EAT authentic Italian food at our restaurants, cafés and to-go counters
* SHOP a selection of high-quality Italian, local and homemade products
* LEARN through our classes and our team’s product knowledge

  

**Job Description**  

The Wine Store Sales Associate assists guests with all steps of their shopping experience including: guiding them to products, securing products out of reach, loading heavy items and making suggestions. Reports to the Beverage Managers.

* Provides prompt, efficient and friendly guest service
* Educates guests about Italian Wines, beer and beverages sold at Eataly
* Receives and stocks wine and wine store merchandise, may review invoices
* Rotates, faces and replenishes merchandise
* Executes La Scuola Sip & Savor wine classes under the direction of the Beverage Director
* Sets up for each class including rolling silverware, setting places and gathering materials
* Checks in guests and introduces classes
* Opens wine and pours for guests
* Describes flavor profile, pairing detail and winery information
* Breaks down after each class
* Performs other duties as required or assigned

  

**Qualifications**  

* High school diploma or equivalent preferred
* Wine sale experience
* Italian wine knowledge preferred

**Job Requirements**

* Ability to exert up to 50 pounds of force occasionally; exert up to 20 pounds of force frequently; exert up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects
* Ability to exert well-paced mobility for periods up to 4 hours
* Flexible availability, including weekends, preferred

  

**Additional Information** **Benefits and Perks**

* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Parental Leave
* 401K with match or RRSP
* Bonus program
* Free family meal daily
* Discounts at Eataly
* Classes on products and Italian cuisine
* Referral bonus program
* and more!

**Compensation:** The base rate for this position is $17 - 21 per hour


Eataly is an equal employment opportunity employer. It is the Company’s policy to not unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic made unlawful to consider by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Eataly also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also Eataly’s policy to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding consideration of unemployment status, salary history, credit/bankruptcy history and criminal background/conviction history in making hiring decisions. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: IT Procurement Analyst
description:
IT Procurement Analyst

**Location: Hicksville, NY**

**Must be a USC or GC holder**

**Must work on a w2**

**No 3rd party/vendors**

SOFT's client, located in Hicksville, NY is looking for a Procurement Analyst for a long term contract assignment. This is a remote position that may become hybrid.  
Job Description:  
The primary objective of this position is to implement a well-defined, well-documented process to ensure that contractual expectations and objectives are met as it relates to information technology and telecommunications service and material providers. Manage the development, negotiation and implementation of major technology and telecommunications related contracts leveraging spend, continuing to re-source recurring contractual commitments on a recurring cycle, manage emergent project work in support of operations, and manage key supplier relationships. Work closely with technology and telecommunication firms to ensure warranties, transfer of ownership, and other contractual agreements are met.

The position has responsibility to assure continuity of supply for all key contracted materials and services. In addition, this position handles technically complex projects and commercial negotiations that occur regularly in support of maintenance and operations.

The primary responsibilities for this position are the management and administration of contracts for various information technology projects being undertaken including: (a) managing change orders, claims and back charges; (b) asserting warranty claims; (c) developing methods for assessing contractor performance; (d) dispute resolution and (e) implementing the appropriate processes and controls for protecting and preserving the Company’s contractual rights and remedies.

For new contracts, this position will be responsible for planning, developing and coordinating innovative contracting strategies and solutions with client personnel, assisting in clearly and completely defining the scope of work, and assessing the qualifications and capabilities of contractors through **RFPs or other processes for $1.5M to $10M contracts.**

**The IT Procurement Analyst will also lead commercial negotiations. The IT Procurement Analyst reports to the IT Operations Procurement Manager.**

**Required Skills**  
**• B.S./B.A. Degree**  
**• 6-10 years large contract management experience.**  
**• 7 years IT and telecommunications service management experience**

* Excellent presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written, are mandatory, as well as a sound

understanding of technology and telecommunications projects and scheduling.

* Demonstrated ability to:

o appropriately assess contractual risk and implement risk management strategies;  
o implement measures and methods to tie payment to performance;  
o **monitor and manage cost and change;**  
**o define and manage deliverables and respective responsibilities between the Company and the contractor.**  
**• Valid driver’s license**

* Demonstrated excellent negotiating skills.

**Desired Skills:**  
**JD, paralegal experience**

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Contract management: 6 years (Required)
* IT and telecommunications service management: 7 years (Required)
* negotiation and implementation: 7 years (Required)
* technology and telecommunications projects: 7 years (Required)
* scheduling: 7 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Hicksville, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Hicksville, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Furniture & Mattress Sales Representative
description:
Commission based pay offering uncapped earning potential!

Looking for Sales Representatives for our Howell location!

No sales experience necessary!

Love where you work! At Value City Furniture, we take pride in giving our guests the very best experience when they shop with us. With a warm greeting and a big smile, every day is an opportunity to turn first time shoppers into loyal, life-long customers!

Our Sales teams stride to give our guests an honest, low pressure, and satisfying shopping experience. We thoroughly enjoy helping our guests fulfill their home furnishing and bedding needs!

We are looking to expand our team of positive, ambitious employees!

We recognize and appreciate all of our employee’s hard work and dedication. As a Sales Representative you will have unlimited earnings potential comprised of a lucrative commission structure, bonuses, company-wide acknowledgement & appreciation luncheons for top performers, along with other incentives.

We offer 4 full weeks of paid hands on training. After that, be prepared for the pathway to earning between $42,000 and $80,000+ annually!

If you're goal driven, motivated by money and interested in a job where you are compensated for all of the hard work you put in, then this fast paced environment is the right fit for you!

**Job Responsibilities and Requirements**

* Greet and engage with customers to uncover their home furnishing and bedding needs by helping their visions become a reality
* Provide exceptional customer service and an unforgettable shopping experience that encourages the guest to purchase with us today and come back again for future needs
* Build rapport with customers with your extensive product and inventory knowledge
* Follow up with customers throughout the process and stay in close communication with updates on their order up until delivery
* Gain knowledge of procedures and policies that foster an environment of structure and respect among peers in the workplace
* Maintain a “Team-Player” mentality at all times through positivity, and rapport with both the customer and coworkers
* Meet/exceed goals set by management
* Take part in company-wide training sessions that are both informative and fun
* Must be able to travel to other locations for training

**Full Time Schedule Expectations**

Scheduled to work a minimum of 40 hours per week including Saturdays and Sundays; the number of hours worked will increase during holidays or blackout periods, or for coverage needs.

Scheduled for two days off each week, except during holidays or blackout periods.

**Benefits and Perks**

* **Full Time**
* Paid training
* Health, Dental, & Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* 401(K) Matching
* Paid Vacation
* PTO
* Employee Discount
* Flexible Schedule

**Part Time Schedule Expectations**

Scheduled to work a minimum of 20 hours a week. Must work one weekend day/night and one full 8 hour shift. Must work Holidays and when coverage is needed the most.

Must work 30 hours a week for health benefits. Must work 40 hours a week to be eligible for Dental, Vision and 401k.

* PTO
* Employee Discount
* Flexible Schedule

Value City Furniture is proud to be an Equal Employment workplace.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Every weekend

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Howell, NJ 07731 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: VP, Software Engineering
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**About the Job**
-----------------


The Vice President of Engineering - Engagement will be responsible for leading a talented engineering team dedicated to enhancing user engagement across all our digital platforms. This role requires a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of digital media, user experience, and cutting-edge technology.


The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of leading engineering teams, developing innovative solutions, and driving measurable improvements in user engagement. Deep technical experience paired with a passion for design and user experience is essential, as this role will partner closely with product and design teams to create compelling and intuitive digital experiences that captivate and engage our global, diverse audience. This is a key position in further strengthening the senior technology leadership team, helping build an innovative, entrepreneurial culture for their group and broader organization. This role reports into the CNN Digital CTO.

**About the Team**
------------------


CNN is a 40+ year storied brand that has been on the forefront of the major news events of our time. We reach audiences around the world, with millions of people coming to CNN to understand events around them.


The CNN Technology team is a growing, vibrant team full of passionate, collaborative technologists. Our mission is to help make CNN essential every day for our customers, by creating world class products to deliver news and information that helps people live a better life, no matter where they are in the world.


The Engagement team is focused on all the surfaces that our audience engages with from CNN.com and the Mobile apps (iOS, Android), to Connected TV devices. This group is passionate about marrying high performing, technically robust, responsive experiences with smooth, intuitive UX that delights and engages our users.

**The Daily**
-------------

* Develop and execute an engineering strategy to drive user engagement across all digital platforms including mobile, web and connected TV.
* Lead, mentor, and inspire a high-performing engineering team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product, design and editorial, to align engineering efforts with business goals and exceed user needs.
* Ability to bring teams together across a large organization to solve problems and improve processes.
* Oversee the development and implementation of scalable, high-performance solutions that enhance user engagement and experience.
* Designs and implements best practices in software development, testing, and deployment in partnership with teams across the organization.
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends, integrating relevant advancements into the company's technology stack.
* Work closely with the analytics and data science teams to measure and analyze user engagement metrics to inform solutions and experiences.
* Identify opportunities to improve user engagement through innovative features, personalized experiences, and data-driven insights.
* Drive the implementation of A/B testing, user feedback loops, and other methodologies, using data to continuously inform and optimize user engagement.
* Oversee project timelines, resource allocation, and budget management to ensure timely and efficient delivery of engineering initiatives.
* Implement agile methodologies and frameworks to streamline development processes and enhance team productivity.
* Monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes.
* Develop and execute strategies to attract, hire, and retain top engineering talent.
* Build a diverse and inclusive team by sourcing candidates from different backgrounds and experiences.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning and professional development, providing opportunities for team members to grow and excel in their roles.

**The Essentials**
------------------

* 12+ years of experience in software engineering, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Ability to think holistically and contribute to broader strategic discussions balanced with nimbleness and getting things done quickly.
* Proven expertise in front-end technologies (e.g., JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React, Angular) and a strong understanding of UX principles and best practices.
* Proven track record of driving user engagement through innovative engineering solutions.
* Demonstrated commitment to web accessibility standards and best practices, ensuring inclusive design for all users.
* Well-rounded understanding of digital media, content management systems, and user experience design.
* Experience using data analytics, A/B testing, and user feedback methodologies.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills equally comfortable discussing complex technical concepts with a team or presenting to executive leadership.
* Ability to effectively collaborate within the team, across stakeholders and partners, and leading through influence.
* Ability to nurture and develop emerging leaders within the engineering team, fostering a culture of mentorship and professional growth.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Knowledge of design thinking principles to foster innovation.
* Leads by example, building trust through every interaction.

**The Nice to Haves**
---------------------

* Participation in and/or contributions to open-source projects.
* Comfort with public speaking and presenting at conferences, webinars, or industry events.
* Exposure to different industries and their unique technological challenges.
* Experience working with global teams or on international projects.
* A broad professional network within the tech industry.


Excited about this opportunity but worried you don't have all the experience we're asking for? We'd still love to hear from you! Please apply and show us what makes you a great fit!

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $343,000.00 - $637,000.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: Vice President - Private Capital Advisory - Real Estate
description:
Region
Americas
Business Unit
Financial Advisory
Location
New York
Job Description
Lazard is one of the world’s leading financial advisory and asset management firms. Our people make the difference. With just over 3,000 employees, our tight-knit community allows for professionals eager to learn and willing to teach to connect and grow together. We believe that diversity, equity, inclusion, and allyship are not just business imperatives — they are central pillars of our employee experience. Our entrepreneurial culture and flat structure allow creative ideas and original concepts to drive our business forward — and for careers to take flight.


Through our financial advisory business, Lazard advises clients around the world on strategic and financial matters including mergers and acquisitions, restructurings, capital structure and capital raising. Our client relationships are built on trust and discretion. As the world’s largest advisory-focused firm, we have exceptional depth of expertise across industry sectors and geographies. We value the rich diversity that comes from blending local perspective with our global network.


Lazard’s Private Capital Advisory Group (“PCA”) is a global leader in raising private capital and executing secondary transactions for investment managers. PCA interacts primarily with institutional investors (sovereign wealth funds, public funds, corporate pension funds, foundations/endowments, financial institutions, and asset managers). One PCA business line is Real Asset Fund Placement, which advises primarily infrastructure and real estate funds seeking to raise private capital. The team is experienced in working with both equity- and debt-focused managers across a range of investment vehicles, including closed- and open-end funds, private REITs, and programmatic joint ventures. PCA is seeking to hire a Vice President for its Real Asset business to focus on transaction management. Our deal teams are typically comprised of 3-4 PCA professionals, including an Analyst, Associate, Vice President or Director and a Managing Director. VPs will work in tandem with Associates and Analysts during the preparation of a transaction (i.e., drafting marketing materials such as a Private Placement Memorandum, preparing track record analyses, preparing the Virtual Data Room, etc.) and during the marketing and due diligence phases of the transaction (i.e., tracking investor outreach, facilitating and answering due diligence questions from potential investors, roadshow coordination, and other responsibilities as part of managing the transaction process).

**We’ll trust you to:**

* Communicate regularly with clients and Lazard's institutional investor coverage professionals
* Prepare marketing materials, including investor presentation materials, private placement memoranda, and financial models
* Manage the details of roadshow, travel and related logistics of capital raising activities
* Prepare responses to investor due diligence requests
* Maintain a database of investor commentary, feedback, and interest in a particular fund
* Prepare presentation materials for prospective clients
* Analyze client investment performance information and assisting in the group's due diligence investigations of prospective clients
* Track market data to assist the group’s communications with fund managers and investors

**You’ll need to have:**

* At least six years of relevant full-time work experience (placement agent or internal investor relations experience is strongly preferred)
* An organized and confident communication style internally and externally, with the ability to manage senior client interaction
* A demonstrated team player attitude and leadership qualities with a strong motivation to contribute to a positive team culture
* Strong ability to multi-task as the role requires the balancing of multiple deals across the Real Assets vertical
* Ability to work independently and be self-motivated
* High level of responsiveness with a strong work ethic and commitment to maintaining a high quality work product
* Top academic performance with comfort operating in an unstructured environment which values initiative, creativity, and maturity
* Ability to support, manage and empower junior bankers
* Infrastructure or Real Estate experience preferred, but not necessary

 **Does this sound like you?**


Apply! We’ll get in touch on the next steps**.**

  

**What we offer:**


We strive to enhance the total health and well-being of our employees through comprehensive, competitive benefits. Our goal is to offer a highly individualized employee experience that enables you to balance your commitments to career, family, and community. When you work for Lazard, you are working for an organization that cares about your unique talents and passions, and will continue to invest in the development of your career.


We expect the base salary range for this role to be approximately $250,000 - $275,000 USD. Various factors contribute to determining the actual base compensation offered, including but not limited to the applicant’s years of relevant experience, career tenure, qualifications, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and relevant skills for the role. Base salary is one component of Lazard Financial Advisory’s compensation package, which also includes comprehensive benefits and may include incentive compensation.

**Inclusion at Lazard**


Lazard is an intellectual capital business focused on delivering the best advice and solutions to clients. Achieving these objectives requires us to identify, develop and retain the best talent. A workforce comprised of people with varied backgrounds and experiences creates a rich diversity of thought that empowers us to challenge conventional wisdom, as diverse perspectives lead to better decisions.


Our appreciation of diversity’s strength is ingrained in our multi-cultural heritage. As a global firm that has grown organically from local roots in different countries, we have a deep tradition of respect for individual differences, which has been core to our success for several decades.


The ongoing cultivation of diversity and an inclusive, equitable culture are essential to our continued growth. We are committed to sustaining an environment in which all employees – regardless of socioeconomic status, race, color, nationality, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, physical abilities, veteran or military status – can maximize their individual potential and our collective success. #LI-EF1
company_description: We value individual differences and operate with a flat management structure in which everyone contributes.

description:
