title: Title V Secretary
description:
The Title V Secretary assists the Title V Project Director in managing the daily administrative operations and coordinating events. Additional responsibilities include maintenance of budget files, program records and reports. The Secretary will have a comprehensive knowledge of college policies and procedures and the federal policies and procedures governing the operation of Title V: Preparing Union Students Career Success.
  

**Characteristics, Duties, and Responsibilities**
* Performs all administrative support duties for the Title V: Preparing Union Students for Career Success program and project staff.
* Collaborates with Title V: Preparing Union Students for Career Success staff and Student Development and Academic Affairs staff.
* Responds to inquiries from prospective and current students.
* Maintains grant budget records and prepares purchase order requisitions.
* Maintains accurate department files and records.
* Coordinates logistics for the Title V: Preparing Union Students for Career Success meetings, workshops, and other events.
* Assists in the preparation of reports for internal and external distribution.
* Collaborates with College Relations to develop program materials.
* Maintains and updates information on the Title V: Preparing Union Students for Career Success Canvas page.
* Records meeting minutes for project meetings.
* Initiates purchase requests for supplies/materials required for operation of the program and follows up on purchases orders and payments.
* Maintains inventory of program equipment.
* Performs other duties as assigned by the Title V Preparing Union Students for Career Success Project Director.
  

  

**Education Requirements**
Associate Degree required.
  

**Experience**
* Administrative office experience with grant projects preferred.
* Minimum of (3) years of office administration experience in an education setting.
  

  

**Competencies and Skills Required**
* Bilingual (Spanish/English), preferred.
* Administrative office experience with grant projects.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 and student information systems.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Effective oral and written communication skills.
* Efficient project and time management skills.
* Professional and ethical decision-making skills.
  

  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* This position’s duties are normally performed in a typical interior/residence work environment, based on the activity scheduled.
* Some physical effort required; however, the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
* No or very limited exposure to physical risk.
* Some travel required.
  

  

**Salary** $36,225-$40,000
  

**Additional Information****Union College of Union County, NJ does not discriminate and prohibits discrimination, as required by state and/or federal law, in all programs and activities, including employment and access to its career and technical programs.**
**Union College of Union County, NJ is an** **EEO****/****AAP** **Employer/Protected Veteran/Disabled**  

**================**  

**Disclaimer:** This job description outlines the general nature and key features performed by various positions that share the same job classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of all employees assigned to the job. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or re-assign duties to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodations or other business reasons.
  

**Terms of Employment**
Full-time grant funded position (Title V Grant-Developing Hispanic Serving Institutions). Flexible schedule to meet department needs. Some evening, weekends, and extended hours will be required. Ability and willingness to travel on short notice to all on and off-campus sites, as needed. Employee must establish primary residency in New Jersey within one year of appointment unless an exemption applies.  

  

**Grant Positions:** Position will be terminated upon expiration of grant funding.
